I understand the need for historical accuracy and developing the story/characters, however maybe just a little less of battle scenes and a little more moving the plot forward would have made this a solid 5 star for me. I will admit that I skipped some parts of the book because of this, and I never skip around in a story.

Having read all of Diana's books and loved them I couldn't wait for the release of Written in My Own Heart's Blood.  What I love about the other other books were Jamie and Claire.  I missed them in this book.  They showed up but  for me not enough.  What I love most about her books are Jamie and Claire's interaction and working together, their support of each other.  It seemed there was less of them in this book.  that being said it was still a great book and good story with a definate sequel coming

I fell in love with Clair and Jamie and their children and friends. Life is an ongoing adventure for them all. Parts of the saga finally come together. There isn't really another book to read. This is #8, so I'm glad the author tied up some of the loose ends. I felt lost for a few days without being able to read more about their lives. It was especially nice to put their adventures into historical perspective. Of course the time travel aspect also added excitement. Well written. Worth reading.

Diana's story-telling, as she weaves the lives and histories of her characters with the history of the times they may be in, always presents a huge wealth of information for me the reader. I appreciate the thoroughness of her research because it makes these people so much more real and lifelike. It enhances my ability to feel what the characters are feeling, to understand their struggles and enjoy the familial love. It always leaves me eager for her next book... Hopefully not too long a wait!

There are a few nit picky things I didn't like, mostly the jumping from one persons viewpoint to another, without announcing whose head I was lodged in, was a bit disconcerting. The book felt as if it was The entire conglomeration of people and gave a feeling of bringing it all together. Although as a personal bit I didn't really like how she handled Bree and Roger towards the end and would have like more follow up....but perhaps that is to be covered in the next book, if there is to be one.

Just finished reading this 8th book in the Outlander series, and already can't wait till the next book. (Poor Diana! Her fault for creating people we want to know more about!) Love this book, love the series, esp like all the complex intriguing characters. Every book gives me a chance to know them all better. Luckily my husband & I are half way through the audio of this book, we listen to the whole series several times a year. (We alternate with listening to the whole Harry Potter series!)

The long-awaited 8th book in the series rescued some of the characters left in time-and-space limbo at the end of the 7th book.  I would have liked a little more about Brianna and Roger and just a bit less Revolutionary War military history, but over all it was a satisfying continuation of the saga and caused me to go back to the beginning to re-read them all.  It's hard to remember all the past details and characters--a few memory prods would have been helpful when reading the last book.

I adore these books! I enjoyed this very much. I have always loved to read about history and the characters Ms. Gabaldon has created for us to love and hate are wonderful, she leaves nothing out when building the lives of her characters. I looked forward to all the different stories in the different times they traveled through, I don't want to give away the story so i instead will say- if you love history and excellent characters within an excellent story, you'll love all her books.

I've waited for 5yrs!!! Well worth the wait!! I loved it all, only objection I have is the ending. I feel like this was the biggest cliffhanger of all of DGs books, a little disappointed. The other books endings made u feel like it could be the end or something else could be coming, this one made me feel like...ugh hopefully by the time Im 40 I'll know what happens with Claire and Jamie. But true fan I am,..I will wait...oh boy I will wait!!  Read it and love it for it is AMAZING!!!

Having a hard time getting through this one. I feel like Diana Gabaldon has been influenced by saying her work is "romance" which it was originally supposed to be historical fiction/fantasy. This starts out in some places like a cheap romance. That isn't what I expect of this series. So, it gets four stars instead of the usual five. I usually can't get enough Gabaldon and the writing is still superb. If I had more time on my hands, I doubt I would be grumpy about it at all.

Disjointed, trite, repeating storylines...just meh. I felt the ending of this book would be fine for the ending of the series. The main characters are together again and safe. Great place to leave it. There is no need to resolve every storyline. Unless you have a novel and fascinating scenario for Jamie and Claire to muddle through Diana, you really don't need to write another one. Love your characters but the plot is getting thin and old. I really was disappointed with this book.

I positively love all the Outlander novels. The one point that brings them down to a 4-star rating for me personally is the excessive historical details, especially of battles, and which general is where, and exactly what his troops are experiencing this moment, ad infinitum. Many people love history and thrive on these details. Not me. Makes me feel like I'm back in high school sweating the next history exam. So I skip all that, enjoy the story otherwise, and everyone's happy.

It took part of two months to finish listening to the latest book in the Outlander series.  There were 45 disks and I only listed while driving.  There are some things that I notice more when listening rather than reading.  I found the amount of detail really amazing.  The level of research to provide it had to have been massive.  It was good to see many of the characters for previous books.  The ending left many things unresolved so I am expecting another book in a few years.

This was a very excellent read that I waited a long time for it to be written by Diana Gabaldon.  I have been a huge fan of this series from day one.  I know it takes her between two and four years to write them but the wait is definitely worth it.  The last book left a lot of things dangling which was a bit disconcerting and seemed unlike the author's previous books.  But this one resolved those issues satisfactorily and I can hardly wait for the next one to be published.

Gabaldon is in my opinion, the best writer of historical fiction I have ever encountered. She is so generous with the details and minutia of life 200 Plus years ago, and evocative to the point of the reader feeling as though these times and places were experienced firsthand! The best evocation is the relationship between the two central characters, Jamie and Claire. Very beautiful portrait of a very good marriage! I love her books, every one. Cannot wait for the next one!

Love this whole series! I admire Diana Gabaldon's ability to mix small details of life in the 1700's (she knows nursing, gardening, cooking, and history) with romance and mystery. In parts, the story drags. Sometimes, a character is abandoned for years. As the stories advance, and the hero, Jamie, and heroine, Claire, are now advancing in age, it's a little more difficult to picture their passionately romantic encounters. I know there was no Viagra or Cialis back in 1778!

Falls short of expectations. There are many loose ends and gaps in the story line. The conclusion seems to have been arrived at in a real hurry. I might have missed some parts of the story but how did Jem, Bree,Mandy get together with the  father? How did they all land on the Ridge together and at that time to end the story? Enjoyed Washington, B Arnold et  al. The description of the war and Clair's role was well researched and well written.  Is this the end of the saga?
while still a good read, it was s/w predictable and repetitive.

I enjoyed this book more than her last in the series. It was entertaining, but moved at a slower pace with less adventure than the earlier books in the series. There are so many characters to follow now it is hard to keep track of them and with 4 years in between novels it is necessary to go back and review. Overall it is still one of my favorite book series and I will continue to read them. If you were frustrated by book 7 I would encourage you to give this a try!

I just finished reading this book and the first thing I have to say is a very heartfelt THANK YOU to Ms. Gabaldon. I absolutely loved it! I took my sweet time reading it because... well, obviously, it will be a good while before the next one, but that's alright with me when a book is this exciting and full of characters that are so well-written that they come to life enough to actually break my heart and make me cry... Or make me laugh...Or make me f-ing mad... :)

I love these books, I'm so hooked, guess I'm intrigued by this time period in Scotland and humanity as well as the conspiracy and theories about the stone circles.  The only draw back now is that I have to wait for the next book to be written and put into print.  I like Diana Gabaldon.  She writes a good story and makes you eager for the next book.  Guess that's what makes a good writer, they leave you hungry for more.  Can't wait till the next book comes out!

I have loved all the books  in the Outlander series,  but I don't think  this one measures up to the earlier ones.  It seems more like a history lesson on the early battles if the Revolution with Claire, Jamie, Ian, ferguson, and his family suc Lord John superimposed on these events.  The sections dealing with Brianne and Rdger seem to be the only ones that retain the the feelings of excitement and character development common to the other books in the series.

I feel as though I just read 800 pages of nothing.  There was nothing eventful in this book that couldn't have been covered in 300 pages or less.  It was an okay read, something to read in the afternoons.  But it felt like nothing more than just keeping up with the day to day happenings of neighbors and patiently listening to their every word every day and hoping something, anything, exciting and different happens.  Yes, I've read all of the previous books.

I cannot believe it's over...I have read all the Outlander books back to back...and lived and breathed Jamie and Claire.  I feel like I have lost something now that it's over.  I am watching the series on TV each week...and then re-watching every episode several times until the next week.  I truly felt that this was one of the very best stories I have ever read.  I like to read for pleasure.  I like fiction and love stories.  This was the ultimate of both!

Absolutely Loved It! Long awaited... and I'm a new Outlander reader having just found the series in 2012! The romance of Claire and Jamie is a fascinating tale - and I'm not a romance book reader! I do love the back and forth between "time zones" and that is the part of this story (hopefully never ending) that I truly adore. I'm not big on the actual battle scenes and this book seemed to have quite a few of those but it was still an excellent read.

The story of the Outlanders has been fabulously entertaining!  I have enjoyed every sequel and will be disappointed when "the end" is left to my imagination.  Diana has a way of describing people, places, events and emotions that makes the reader feel he/she is there.  And yet there is always a twist in her stories that will entice the reader into wanting to read the next book!  I am looking forward to the next book and to viewing the film edition!

Another excellent example of a well written book.  My only comment would be that it reads like a series of episodes rather than one big story.  (Almost as if it had the TV series in mind.)  However that is to be expected in the 8th installment.  There was a little bit too much detail on some things which I felt didn't add anything and could have been left out or at least reduced somewhat but overall a good read and a nice end to the Jamie and Claire story.

Everything she writes is totally captivating.  However, this one dragged a little.  I have just finished reading novel seven and I suspect considering all the loose ends still hanging, that there will be a novel eight.  Now, I'm so into the eighteenth century I don't know what I'm going to do with the rest of my life. .Thankfully, season two is going to be viewable on Starz, so that is sustaining me.  I actually just subscribed to Starz so I could see it.

A good overall read but I found it difficult to remember who many of the characters were and their back story from previous books. It would have been helpful to have a cheat sheet of characters. But I'm always impressed with Gabaldon's attention to detail and historical data. I wished more of the story was about Jamie and Claire, as opposed to Roger and his search. Also I wonder if another book might be in the works as the ending was a bit open. Enjoy!

I'm a Diana Gabaldon-Outlander fan so I'll take what I can get, and what I got was to immerse myself in book #8 in the series, lost in its characters and stories until the rude awakening, pleasant though it was, of the subtle end. What I now get to do is wait until the next with anticipation, watch the TV series, listen to the first audio book with husband who enjoys the TV series too, and see if there are an "in betweens, etc" I've missed.

The wonderful saga of Claire and Jamie continues - makes you cry with frustration when you reach the final few pages. Looking forward to seeing how Brianna and Roger's coming back will affect the coming story. Ms Gabaldon, I know it takes a few years to properly prep these books - but please - not another four years of torture wondering what will come next. Have read and reread this series at least 10 times. Looking forward to rereading again soon.

This book continues the Outlander series and I couldn't put it down, although I had to slow down near the end, not wanting it to end. The characters and events so fully fleshed out draw you in until you feel a part of the adventure. If you haven't already, start at the beginning and enjoy the richness of the writings of Diana Gabaldon. As for me, until the next book is completed, I will start again at book one.  I cannot give these characters up.
a dissapointment after reading the other books in the series

While Jaime our favourite super hero reigns supreme, the character of Ian is further developed and given some depth. He truly becomes a man and one that mirrors our main character in many ways. We are treated to a happily ever after ending when Brianna literally turns up with her family. There are still enough loose ends for another book but we'll see...I'm looking forward to the resumption of the tv series, which is a long way off, regrettably.

I have been reading this series of books since 1991 when I came across Outlander in paperback. I have been entranced ever since!!! I have read all the books in the series and can't wait for the next one! This book, like the others, gives an intimate portrait of the lives of Jamie and Clair and the people in their lives!! I LOVE IT!!!!! My only complaint is that I know I now have a long wait for the next one!!! Lol!!! But it will be worth it!!!!

Really, at this point, do I really need to explain the awesomeness that is Jamie and Claire? If you're thinking about reading book 8, I doubt there's much I can say to sway you either way. Even though some parts may drag a little bit, the characters and their journey make it all worthwhile. Rich, entertaining, funny, touching. This book is all of that and more. I've grown up with these people, and look forward to growing old with them as well.

What doesn't Diana Gabaldon write with extraordinary panache and great skill.  It is classified as sci-fi, romance, historical fiction, etc.  This author weaves an amazing amount of detail into the story which is factual,  leaving me to feel like I have a working knowledge of herbs, early medicine, places in the book, and historical events.  I find myself becoming invested in Diana's characters, and have been reading her books since the 90's.

Once again this woman wins........she is true magic, going from one adventure to another and linking them all up,we are viewing her first TV special ."Outlander" this week (here in OZ) so I am looking forward to meeting Claire and Jamie Frazer and seeing if he looks as good as he does in my head .Not much keeps a. 70 year old excited but her books have given me pleasure the last 15 years or more. MANY THANKS Diana ,.Cheerio. Christine

Diana has picked up perfectly from the last book in this series, continuing on and bringing any reader into Jamie and Claire's world without confusion of not having prior knowledge of the series background. I actually do not consider myself a reader.... I just picked up her first book an year ago and have read them all, they contain a little of everything: history, romance, adventure, mystery, fantasy. Diana has opened up a new world for me.

I have been a fan since the beginning and love how Ms. Gabaldon brings the characters to life and really makes you care about them.  Her research show and her descriptions of various aspects of life during that time are amazing.  I hope she never tires of writing about these characters, because I can't wait to see what happens next.  How lovely to end this book with the Fraser family together, but I'm sure there are more adventures to come!
Good book. Sad that it's over. Can't wait for the next one.

I'm a devoted fan and follower of Diana Gabaldon and her incredible gift of storytelling. Her skill of pulling one into the lives of her characters doesn't disappoint. However I feel this book delves into military conflict much too much for my liking. It is a common thread in the different storylines and I appreciate that but it's just too much detail. I was disappointed also that Brianna's storyline was all but left out of this book.

Oh Wow... Just finished it.  Diana's writing keeps you hanging on until the last paragraph.  I think I went through every emotion.  If you have any interest in history with a wee bit of Sci-Fi and of course a very strong love story, you will absolutely adore how she weaves them together.  I believe she is in the process of writing yet one more book for all the "Outlander" fans out there.  Now to be patient while she creates!

I just finished this book and was surprised that the ending left it open to a possible next book!  I always enjoy a good series.  I get attached to the characters and stories and don't want them to end.  This book, although I did give it 5 stars, was a little heavy on war and battle.  However, I understand it was necessary given the time and place.  I liked that a lot of loose ends got tied up.  I'm looking forward to the next book!

I never thought I would enjoy a series as much as I have this one.  I've owned the book for a few years,but didn't think that I could relate to the characters.  Boy, was I wrong.  This entire series has been the most fantastic journey.  I only wish it didn't take 4 years to write the next book.  So many stories and questions unanswered.  I'm looking forward to the next adventures on Frasier Ridge.  Diana Gabaldon...please write Fast

It's been a while since I read the last book in this series, not having diverted to the companion 'Lord john' series, but the characters came back to me like long lost friends. I love Claire's internal dialogues, and the descriptions of being a well trained 21st century doctor and surgeon without the tools and medicines of today at hand. I read it on the bus, in bed, on my Exercycle and in the bath. I couldn't put it down......

I have read each book since I came across one of them at a Highland' s game...and this one doesn't let you down.  I like the storyline with Jamie and Claire and friends and family the war in America on one hand and their daughter Brianna and kids on another hand, not to forget her husband in another time period mistakenly looking for their son Jemy....I just hope the next book comes soon so I can see what is next in their lives.

There are a lot of us who have followed Jamie and Clair through time, Scotland, Jamaica and America, anticipating their next adventure. I have never been disappointed. This last book has been wonderful.  It brought all the wonderful characters that we have known and loved to such a wonderful place. Just loved the ending.  The Outlander series has given me some of the best reading ever!  I have read her series twice, so far.....

...is it 2018 yet!? Another triumphant literary example of the depth and passion of Ms. Gabaldon to portray with mere words a world both fascinating and exhilarating, with the power to make me want to forsake modern life and somehow find my circle of standing stones to join Jamie and Claire. Thank you for this escape. Now I'm torn between the feeling of success at completing the book and the overwhelming urge to read it again!!

I love the whole Outlander series.  I have waited impatiently for this latest volume.  I'm only half way through, but I can't put it down.  Just wonderful in every way and you just want to find out what is going to happen next.  Before I started this book, I scanned the last 200 pages of "An Echo In The Bone" just to get caught up with how the previous book from the series ended up.  It really helped get into this book.

As with the preceding 7 Outlander books, this one was very entertaining. These books while historical fiction do have a definite flavor of swashbucklers.  This one included 3 separate strains of the story at the outset and they continued separately throughout the most of the book, though they were a bit too neatly tied up on the last page.  The inclusion of actual 18th Century persons with talking parts seemed a bit odd to me.

Great book.. Did not disappoint.. I loved it! I had read a semi negative review before reading this book, that a fan thought there was to much about Bree and Roger in the story, but there really wasn't.. It has a wonderful balance of the main characters, and while the ending is not a cliff hanger, it kinda was, because it left me wanting more and immediately wishing I didn't have to wait another 4/5yrs to find out what's next!

Great book was just disappointed in it's condition. It was seemingly new in every way but part way through the book realized some of the pages were all tore up. Looked like it was something that may have happened in manufacturing because of the way the tears went all through a section of pages. Disappointed it made it through quality control that way and hoping that Amazon was not purposely selling this damaged book as new. ?

I love  Jamie and Claire, but ever since the plot moved to America it hasn't been as engaging. I liked the book, but was bored. Nothing much really happened, I am completely uninterested in Lord John and William, who got a lot of story time. I was most interested in Brianna and Roger, but they got much less time. Overall, I liked it but it dragged on.

Reading this was like sitting down and visiting with old friends. No one else writes a book like Diana Gabaldon. She develops her characters into believable people. The historical setting is accurate and believable. The book has a sweetness and devotion to family and friends. The story continues to surprise and endear the reader. Jamie Fraser lives his life with honor and integrity. Oh, what a man! And the ending is perfect!

I didn't rush out and buy it immediately not because I didn't want to, but because I wanted to reread the two previous books before traveling back to the 18th century. As always, a delightful, entertaining installment. I love this series and have since I finished the original after an all night read July 4, 1991. So much information, so many characters that breathe so much life into this epic tale. Thank you, again, Diana.

I'm always amazed how Diana Gabaldon is able to write book after book, continually enriching her characters and building on the adventures and landscapes in which they live. I suppose it helps that I have a Scots background (Mackenzie!) and that I live in Philadelphia,as well as the fact that I'm a Quaker - it seems that she wrote the books for me! I have read every one, so now I'll take a break then start all over again.

The Outlander series and it's characters are like home to me. This book was one of my favorites although I've read so many pages of the series, I have forgotten a lot of the details!  The history, the depth of the characters, the varied plot lines and that endless, timeless, passionate love between Claire and Jamie! I cried with joy at the end but now I'm sad it's over. Write another, Ms. Gabaldon! A true artist of words.

Haven't finished this book yet (I have more than a few books that I'm reading at once [!]; however, I LOVE this series. Diana Gabaldon is genius. I've learned so much more about American History than I ever did in high school. And of course  the Jamie / Clare relationship is so yummy - who doesn't want that? Highly recommended. Oh! Outlander is now a series on STARZ. Saw the first one and was not disappointed - beautiful!
Absolutely one of the best series I have ever read. Highly recommended. Be sure and read the whole Outlander series.
It was a bit more disjointed than the previous books.  It was good to be able to follow the same characters but the story didn't really flow and was more difficult to follow

Diana Gabaldon has written a wonderful, captivating tale of characters with great depth, again.  Well worth the long wait, and many loose ends were tied together in a most gratifying way.  The story ends on a hopeful note with promise of a ninth book to continue on into the future.  I would recommend this book to all who truly love historical fiction and a story where the the folks within become your family and friends.

Pulls your right into the saga and wrenching when the saga ends . I find fastenating how she brings in medical and other natural knowledge ...she teaches us her audience ...one itty bitty criticism and that is the sex thing is getting a bit worn ...spoken by an old fart married to the same gal for 43 years and still thinks she is beautiful and sexy but still think your depictions might best be left behind closed doors !

I LOVED seeing some characters come back into the storyline and be developed more, and like always, I love having Roger and Bree in the books. This was the first Outlander series I read on my kindle and I have to admit, it was not nearly as daunting as when I read the hardcovers. Gabaldon delivered yet again and now I'm disappointed I have to wait until whenever the next book comes out for more Highland love in the US.

I'm a big fan of Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series . . . . I just wish she would write the sequels quicker.  The last three books were released 5 years apart!  Since the first page of each book reads as if you have just turned the last page of the prior book, I always have to reread at least the prior book to help me recall who is who and what is going on.  But once I get myself up to speed, I love her literary style.

Last (?) Outlander novel is long and complex.  When you reach the end, there are still some characters left dangling, in my view.  It definitely continues the saga and stays true to the characters.  I like the author's historical detail and having just been trudging up some PA terrain, could easily visualize the battle and marching scenes. Ms. Galbondon continues her use of humor and is very adept at helping the reader visualize her scenes. This seemed to be a tying up ends book, which is why I gave it 4 stars out of 5.

I like the series, but this was not my favorite book in the series even though it was long-awaited. It was difficult to recall all the minor characters and their connections -- even though I have read all the other books in the series. I don't think it would be very satisfying at all to a reader who is new to the series. As usual, the major characters were still endearing and I want to know what happens to them next.

It's always been hard for me to put these books down for wanting to know what's going to happen next and yet slowing down towards the end knowing that this may be the END. I'm hoping that there will be a book 9 in the works. I have grown to love all of the characters.  I have recommended this series to family, friends and even strangers. Thank you for bringing them back to the Ridge. This has been an emotional ride.

Just when I think there can't possibly be any more adventures, suspense, surprises, romance, kinship, etc Diana Gabaldon proves me wrong. The characters that I love become more complex and endearing with each book. As always she leaves me longing for the next book with her dramatic endings. And the greatest lovers of all time, Jamie & Claire, remain just that to me. Oh......and I so enjoy the historic details too!

There aren't enough stars to "grade" any of the Outlander books. I loved them all!  The storyline and characters drew me in ,and still have not let go. I miss Jamie,Claire,Brianna,Roger,Lord John,etc,like they were members of my family,and I am mourning their loss. I would like to know how Roger and Bree got back/forward to Jamie and Claire's time,and what happened with William,but,alas,the books had to end sometime.

Written in My Own Heart's Blood neatly ties up many loose ends in the Claire/Jamie saga while promising new tales of all the characters I have come to love.  The only problem with Diana's books is that I want to go on to the next one as soon as I finish each one. Wonder how long it will be this time?  Price, shipping and packaging all the top standard that I have come to expect from Amazon.  Overall very pleased.

Claire is still amazing; Jamie has everything in hand -- including his beloved Claire.  No one could keep up without having read the other titles -- there are just too many assumptions that the reader knows the history, the relationships, the myriad settings.  However, true fans will not be disappointed with the latest tome.  I won't be a spoiler -- read the 800+ pages to find out if this is the end of the story.

This ongoing story, just amazes me. Diana Gabaldon is a hero in her own right! How she brings her characters to life and makes you feel like your living the story along with the characters just gives me goosebumps. So looking forward to book nine. But unlike others I have the patience to wait, because Diana never fails to deliver her best.

Not as good as her previous books.  Jumped around too much and had to reread to get the story.  Will give Diana much credit though.  She writes well and is well informed on her subjects.  Will read her books again.  This is #8 in this series.  Helps to check out the family history and dates and get the clear in your mind as you start at the beginning of the book .  I have loved her previous books in this series.

Great continuation of the story of Jamie and Claire.  I don't know how she does it but Diana Gabaldon keeps on going  with the story.  I have all the books in the series, the Outlandish Companion, The Scottish Prisoner and some of the Lord John books.  These are by far the best books in a series I have ever read!!  They have made them into a series on Starz which I do not get but am hoping it comes out on DVD.

This is an excellent followup to "Echo in the Bone".  The author's in depth research of the American Revolutionary War along with her wonderful character and plot development make this one of my favorite reads this year.  I understand that Ms Gabaldon is now working on the next book in the "Outlander" series and I can hardly wait for it to be published.  She is one of my most favorite authors.

I loved this book! I l really enjoy all of Diana's books. You get a good description of characters, places, and people and you can really immerse yourself in her world. You connect with her characters and you travel their journey. This was a good addition to the series. The story has it all, tragedy, danger, cunning, excitement, comedy and all other aspects you would want. I recommend it and the whole series.

Diana Gabaldon continues to take us on the adventures of Claire Beauchamp Randall Fraser, her husband, the ever-hot, every-woman-wants-him James Alexander Malcolm MacKenzie Fraser, in this her eighth book in the enormously popular historical fiction series that began with Outlander in 1991.  Love, sex, romance, time travel, characters you truly fall in love with and a book you'll want to read again and again.

This is the eighth book in the Outlander series.  Although I just received it, I can say it will be one of my favorite books as I still have the other seven.  I am re-reading book seven, "An Echo in the Bone" before starting "Written in My Own Heart's Blood" since it is five years between publication.  This is a wonderful story with lots of romance and history.  I recommend this series highly.

I have been reading her books for 13 years.  I knew this one would have to last me a long time so I took my time reading it.  It is as enjoyable as the rest.  I just wish it wasn't so much time between books.  I might go back and read them from the beginning again. I love the audio books also.  Miss Parker is a joy to listen to.  I just hate it when the book is over because I won't hear her voice for awhile.

I wondered if I could keep up with all the characters since it had been a while.  Diana Gabaldon brought me up to speed very quickly with her storytelling skill.  I love being whisked away to another time and place.  No one I have read does it better!  This is another breathtaking yarn.  If you're already on board with this series, it does not disappoint.  If not, you're probably busily downloading the rest.

This series appeals on so many levels. It's historically informative, medically interesting, emotionally balanced (bad things do happen-even to good people), totally unpredictable and lastly, portrays the most endearing, heartwarming and realistic romantic bond that continues to endure and maintain strength over many years. Sadly, You don't get a lot of that in romantic novels. I so don't want this to end.

I waited a long time for the new book and I was not disappointed. I love these books and the character development and am only sad that I have to wait until the next book is done. I will have to start reading the series over from the beginning very slowly until the new book is ready. I have been reading Diana's dailies of the new book and watching the series to tide me over until the next book comes out.

This book is chock full of more "Outlander" excitement with many surprise plot twists and an ending that leaves you wondering how you'll be able to wait for the next book in the series. As with each "Outlander" book, I wanted it to continue forever, but it has been 12 or 13 years since I read "Outlander" so I'm rereading the series while I anxiously await Gabaldon's next offering.

Changed my mind on this rating. I'll give it four stars instead of three. As I get older, I know what age does to the minds and bodies of us all. I have trouble with Jamie and Claire's vitality at this stage of the game. But, all things considered, Gabaldon works her magic with prose made in heaven to compensate. I spent some time reading again today and am captured by the beauty of the story as a whole.
It wasn.t as interesting as all of her previous books.

Now that I have finished the eighth book, I am finding myself wanting to know when the next one will be written. I have fallen totally for Jamie Fraser. I can see him as I read, even though I only got to see the premiere showing of the beginning of the series. Claire fascinates me, being modern & archaic at once. Thoroughly enjoyable experience, all eight of the books in the Outlander series. Thank you.

What can I say, this is one of my favorite series of all time, and Written In My Own Heart's Blood  does not disappoint.  I was deeply engrossed with the  richly woven characters. Love, triumph, love, tragedy, love, joy,love, anguish, love, life, love, death, but love overall! One of the greatest love stories ever! I tried to savor this read, but all good things must end. I can't wait for the next book!

I love the Outlander Series by Diana Gabaldon and rated all of her books a 5 star except this last one.  Written In My Own Hearts Blood is still "wonderful reading" its just the flow of the book is nothing like the previous 7 books. The book flows everywhere, skipping from one scenario to another quickly, it's not got the slow flow of the story in the previous books that make it easy to follow.

I love her books. I reread all of the previous books again, so I would be up to date on this book and I was disappointed. I had wait with so much anticipation for this book to be released, read it all the way thru in 2 days. The book is written as well as all the other books but it did not go anywhere. It does not even cover a year of time in their lives. Now I will have to wait years for the next one.

I always enjoy the Author's wit and unique phraseology.  This book was just as fun and interesting as the others.  But I could see a lot of it coming.  I suppose that is the risk with this type of long term serial story telling.  So, a little predictable but the story had to go this way unless Gabaldon wanted to kill off more of her characters - thank God she's not JRR Martin!  Overall a good fun read.

I was introduced to the Show by a Podcast that I listen to daily.  I was so intrigued by the Show that I decided that I wanted more, so I found the book series and I read any free time I get.  It is none stop and you have to be ready for adventure around every turn.  Highly recommend if you are looking for a long term reading series, 8 books plus another on the way, plus companion books to good along.

I thoroughly enjoy the Outlander books, this one included. While it wasn't my favorite, I like Jamie & Claire and many of the supporting characters. However, the way the book ended you can tell that Gabaldon will probably have another book written within the next few years. The ending wasn't a cliffhanger like the previous book but there were a lot of story lines that can be expanded and/or explained.

Diana does it again.....my only complaint is that it wasn't longer! :-) My favorite series of all time, very hard to put down once you have started. Always great how the lives of the characters are intertwined with one another. Claire and Jamie are like old friends....that are always fun to catch up with. Looking forward to the next great chapter(s) in her next book. Thanks for the amazing read again!

Of course the language is abominable.  It is full of descriptive sex.  If you can get beyond this then you can read this book and see the movie.  I have to believe that the movie would not be better than the book since it is on tv.  It surely could not be filmed as descriptive as the book.  One last question or rather statement...  Please tell me that you are not going to leave it as is. I hate cliff hangers.  There is still story to be told...

I'm a pretty straight forward person so this will be a straight forward and quick review. This book was good in the beginning and great at the end. The middle was full of long boring fillers. This is how she writes most of her Outlander series books with a few exceptions. The ending was good enough to make me read the next one.

The outlander series has to be hands-down the best series I have read in a long time. If you are interested in historical novels, this is a must read series. The characters are well-developed, the action is fast-paced, and the storylines draw you in to the world with a yearning for more. The author leaves just enough dangling to allow for a few spinoffs in the future should there be some. Well done.

The Saga continues but this one does seem to bring the story to a natural close. Not that there isn't room for another episode. The conclusion does seem to tie all the loose ends up rather rapidly and leave their future seeming pretty predictable. But the journey along the way is as fulfilling and exciting as the rest of the series. It you liked the rest of the books, you have to read this one, too!

Loved this book, maybe just the best yet in the Outlander series.  Lots of action, love, history and territory covered.  Great ending as well.  I highly recommend this series.  LOVED LOVED LOVED it.  I don't think I can get enough of Jamie and Claire and their adventures.  While all the secondary characters are enjoyable, Jamie and Claire remain the driving force and the most interesting characters.

I was very disappointed in this book. Not the story but that it ended. I was blown away by her attention to detail. With every book she ties the story's together so well that they become seamless.  If you haven't had the pleasure of reading a book from this series you are seriously missing out. I highly recommend you start with book 1 Outlander, and work your way to Written in My Own Heart's Blood.

I loved the first 2 books in the series....and then came Written in My Own Heart's Blood.  I think it surpassed all of them.  It brought everything together.  But don't let this be the last book please...I could go on reading about Jamie, Claire, Brianna, Roger, John and Willie for years.  As a matter of fact what is going to happen to Willie, you can't just let him walk away from Jamie like that.

Diana Gabaldon has improved her writing style over the time she has spent on this series.  I thoroughly enjoyed this book.  There was humor, terror, love, and stories of interesting characters.  She should have placed the story of Brianna and Roger in a separate book.  How did they get from the 1720's in Scotland to the 1780's in America?  I so hope this isn't the last of the series.  I want more.
Diana never fails to meet our greatest expectations !
Love Gabaldon but this one was extremely predictable.

Pretty disappointing after the buildup and cliff-hanger ending of the last book. Lots of potential action that fizzled into nothing, and the ending was a lame "happy ending" with no explanations of how it got there. Too much gratuitous sex as filler for a real story. I think Diana Gabaldon is tired of her characters.

Definitely one of the best of the series; my favorite of the last 4 or 5 books for sure. Super satisfying, quick read, but still left wanting more. Page-turning stories interwoven with lots of intimate moments and wonderful conversation with all the characters we love. Great stories in this for Jamie & Claire, Lord John, Young Ian, William, and lots more. Cannot wait to read the next installment.

I've just finished the whole series. Very remarkable how I became do so captured by the characters and flow of this story line. Extremely well written. I was so engrossed in this story that now that have finished, I feel lost. I know I will have a hard time finding one that make me feel like I did while reading the legacy of Jamie and Claire Frazier. So looking forward to watching the TV series.

Completely disappointed. I lived the other books but this felt disjointed and not fully developed. I think the author loved the characters too much and I felt like there was little movement for part of the book dragged  too long and was too descriptive. How many surgeries can you read before it gets monotonous. Sorry this was disappointing and felt like a bridge to the end with no real answers.

LOVE the outlander series.  Read at least half the books twice.  But this book was different.  Maybe too many story lines.  Maybe too chopped up.  And maybe that was on purpose - the book felt chaotic, and maybe that was meant to reflect the chaos of the war descrbed throught the story.  But I didn't like it.  Will definitely buy the next book in the series, but hope the style doesn't continue.

Continuing Clair and Jamie's life journey during the American Revolution is informative and entertaining.  Diana Gabaldon has written another engaging book.  I rated it four rather than five stars because it was easier than some of her previous books to put down and come back to later. I am ready for the next installment!

Normally love her books but this book didn't seem worth the wait. The first half seemed to repeat too many things catching the reader up with what happened in the last books after such a long break in the story. The second half spent much of its time wrapping up the series. Loved the story and characters but like most great series maybe this one should have ended several thousand pages before.

Have loved reading the Outlander series and was looking forward to this addition. But..although I liked it, I found it very disjointed jumping from story line to story line. It also didn't hold my attention like some of the other books .. I was able to put it down easily. Finally, the ending left many unanswered questions which can only be answered by another book which I will look forward to.

I could read Diana Gabaldon for the rest of my life and still not get enough of her characters!!  This series is the epitome of wonderful - the characters are full of life and coloful, the whole plot just changes and changes, never lets you lose interest, her writing is fluid - you will not go wrong in reading the entirety of this series.  If you're like me you won't be able to put it down!

I have found all the books of this series compelling. There is a bit too much detail for my taste and I find myself breezing through a lot of it to get to the main thread of the story. I found the authors wide knowledge and use of vocabulary fitting the time amazing and was glad my reader has its dictionary so easily available!  There are plenty of twists and turns to keep the story fresh.

Alternates between Claire's story and Brianna's. Some people complained that the bits about the war dragged on and that some of the medical issues were too gory and descriptive but this is what makes these books appeal to so many and I can't fault Diana for her attention to detail. The ending was wonderful and I can't wait for the next book. Probably one of my favorite books in the series.

I am so glad you wrote this book, I loved reading the first seven and I had so many questions.  This book is answering them for me, I am so glad to be reading it. Before it was released I was so disappointed when I completed the 7 book series. I really wanted to read more about the characters and the places and times they were in.  I Highly highly highly recommend it.  Love it!  Thank you.

I loved this book as much as the seven before it in the Outlander series. Diana Gabaldon is so gifted in her writing style, she pulls you into the story in 5 minutes flat. Throughout my life I have been a reader, hands down this is in the top 5 of every book I have read in my life. It's so good, I really can't think of it ever to end, like when the characters get old and die, unthinkable.

I love this series, and the reading the new book was like spending time with old friends. Not much happened plot wise, though, for the huge number of pages in the book. Too many side stories going on. There are a lot of great characters in this series, however, that doesn't mean they need their own storylines. I only care about them in the context of their relations with Jamie and Claire.

If you have enjoyed the previous Outlander books then you'll love the new release.  It continues to weave the characters' stories with amazing detail to historical events, to the 19th century language, dress and customs and of course the underlying science fiction twist to the series still is present and plays into the plots twists and moments that leave us now waiting for the next book.

I have long been a fan of this series and was eagerly awaiting this book. I was disappointed with this one -- I found it to be quite disjointed and at times very hard to follow. Too many different threads, and it had been so long since the last book that I had to stop and re-read portions of Book 7.  There were a few events that just didn't make sense....maybe Book 9 will sort that out.

Diana Gabaldon is amazing.  Her ability to describe a scene and her character's conversations so vivid that one is literally spellbound from beginning to end.  I can only hope there will be a book #9.  I go into Jamie and Claire withdrawal at the end of each book and Written in My Own Heart's Blood is no exception.  I know I will read it again just as I have the other 7 books before it.

As with all Diana Gabaldon's books, I eagerly awaited the arrival of this one. Once again I was transported into a different time, a time that Diana makes so believable. The Outlander series of books is by far my all time favorite. I recommend any new reader to start at the beginning and become part of this wonderful author's travel through time and enjoy the ride with Jamie & Claire.

Love every one of the Outlander books. This one, as usual, kept me enthralled, could not put it down. Love all the characters, including Clarence and Rollo.  Wish it didn't take her so long to write one, I am so afraid I won't be around for the last book, that hopefully answers all the questions I have including the what and why of Jamie's "ghost" first appearing in Outlander.

Take place where you left off and end holding your place. This book intertwines the stories of Jamie and Claire, Roger and Brianna and many other characters that have been introduced in previous books. This book is similar to others in detail and following the lives of the characters as they venture through time. Be prepared for another book after this one as there's no end in sight.

Diana Gabaldon has done it again! Not only having great historical accuracy for how things were done in the time, but showing characters that are so real you want to have them over for dinner. They love deeply without always liking each other; have life sweep them off their feet and rise again bloody and bruised but not broken. Looking forward to the next book to continue the story!

Another Winner for the readers of the Outlander series! As always, the book ended too soon which is funny due to the length of all the books in the series. I immediately felt the comfort of the characters like long lost friends. I also appreciated the normal aging that has taken place with the characters. I will bide my time until the next book with the series coming to life on TV.

I just finished reading in My own Hearts Blood. I had to reread the previous one first, as I couldn't remember the fine details of the characters or events and this book takes off right where the previous one ends.four years is a long time and a brief synopsis would help. This said, this book was my favorite', even the war scene . I loved the ending . I cannot wait for the next one

Diana Gabaldon"s Outlander series is by far one of  my favorite series books to read.  Diana has the creative ability to encompase historical data in with romance and make you feel you are a part of  the story.  I have the entire collection and have re-read them many times.  They are well written and hold your interest page after page.  I would highly  recommend them to anyone.

I have been a huge fan of this series. But sadly this book left me feeling cheated. It was not as enjoyable as the others in the series. Lacking a clear story line. It felt fragmented. The ending was wonderful  and the medical scenes accurate and very well done. I am not sorry I read it, but I am disappointed.

DIana Gabaldon overwrites about as much as one possibly can, and it gets more evident with every book. I am somewhat disappointed that the characters are no longer in Scotland, because the original setting was part of what made me enjoy the story. This new chapter in the saga had plenty of twists and turns to make me want to read on, when (in several years) the next one comes out.

My guts have been exposed and left hanging.  Ha Ha....I hate that I have to wait, but I am only one singer in a huge choir.  This book has left me hanging out in the cold, but I have loved and not regretted one single moment of the torture.  I miss my family in these characters and wonder what they are doing.  I know full well they are living an exciting adventure in Diana's head.

This is definitely the weakest of a long, compelling series. The weak, disjointed, ambling plot, the excessive and lengthy battle descriptions, and the multitude of random miscellaneous characters who have nothing to do with the tale made it difficult for me to enjoy this book.  I'm a huge fan of the author and this series, but most definitely not a fan of this book in particular.

As always her tomes are remarkable in the scope and the many different characters she creates.She is a master at creating interesting plots for all her characters to engage in It does take her a long time to write her books, but they are MORE than worth waiting for..I'm sad to see the end of Claire and James Fraser however.I think this is her last book in this series., Outlander.

I love this series, although I wonder if I'm getting too old, or something!, for the relentless action and drama.  I would love for Claire and Jamie to just stay home for a while and stay out of trouble....but what kind of story would that be?  This book is full of excitjng U.S. history, love, intrigue, ghastly bleeding wounds, and of course all the characters we know and love.

I love all the books, this most recent is great, could rarely put it down and was anxious to pick it up again each time. I love the closeness of family and even if not blood linked, the deep and abiding love is there. I often get bored when authors switch between character's lives, but not when Diana does it, she keeps up the interest throughout. I highly recommend this book.

I like historical fiction in general. I LOVE historical fiction that is fairly accurate in it's portrayal of the times in which it is set AND tells an interesting story/s, with 3-dimensional realistic interesting characters. Every book in Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series meet these conditions outstandingly. #8 in this series, Written in My Own Heart's Blood is no exception.

In my opinion, the best one in the series so far with the exception of the first one!  Loved the action and the character development.  Gabaldon is so beautifully consistent with her characters and their behaviors.  In this volume, I really felt the impact of the time in our history when people simply "did what needs to be done."  Beautifully written start to finish.

I have read the first set of books at least twice.  This continues to be a wonderfully exciting and entertaining series! A bit of science fiction, a bit of history, and a bit of imagination. The characters are great, the stories are great, and each book is hard to put down. Regret that they are so voluminous! Smarts when falling asleep in bed & the book hits the nose ;-) !

I am truly disappointed in this long awaited novel. Normally if a book doesn't grab me after the first two chapters? I'm done. I slogged through 500 pages and THEN the story began. I think Diana got sidetracked with the whole "Hollywood" effect, which I hope doesn't break her heart or spirit.

In this, the last book in the Outlander series (at least at this time), I felt the author was trying to grasp at the ending. The book didn't go into the details of how Brianna and her family were reunited with her parents. I would like to see at least one more book on what happens after this last book leaves off. I guess I'm not yet ready to relinquish Jamie and Claire.

I just finished this book.  It was long, but it read like a great journey.  I felt a little thrown off by the different perspectives, and could always tell who was speaking, but overall I thought it added to the story.  Not all the mysteries were solved at the end of this book, but it definitely has me ready for the next one.  Hopefully more questions will be answered.

Till now, the author has not disappointed me.  Great reading.  Informative of the time, love the people who fill hours of pleasure.  Quite descriptive, true romance.  She places the reader into the time.  Would love to find those stones and travel back.  Just would enjoy watching first hand what I am reading.  Ms. Gabaldon is one of the best story tellers of all time.

Diana once again doesn't disappoint!  Loved it and can't wait for the next one.  The quality of her writing spoils the reader so that trying to find another author with her skill at story telling is difficult.  Once again it's hard to put her in any particular category as she crosses so many.  I hope she doesn't stop!  The twists and turns keep you glued to the page.

Amazing that this author can keep our interest while turning out great stories with much historical accuracy. Read  David McCullough's  1776 for more of the time period if Gabaldon's characters' involvement in the American Revolution raises your interest in this war. The book is entertaining if not graphic about daily life and work. Waiting for the next installment.

Best eight books I have ever read.  I am from Scotland so I know their personality (a wee bit dour)  I was so impressed by the way she captured the Scottish sense of humor (even while dying a painful death her characters had a dry sense of humor).  The history was amazing and the love story incredible.  Can't wait for the next one (hope it doesn't take five years)!

Diana Gabaldon once again brings her family of time-travelers to life in multiple time zones. As usual, the pace is brisk, action constant, and historical details interesting. This time suffered from a lack of focus--the story of Bree & her family particularly suffered. Gabaldon at least keeps the installments coming nag at a good pace, unlike other authors (GRRM)

Love this book and the series but, as previously stated in another review, there are several themes and bad happenings that are repeated in several of the books.  I realize that rape happens a good bit in this time but, not usually to almost all of the family members at one point or another.  Maybe it's time to find something else dramatic to make happen to them?

How can I say I dislike anything, as I do not...it is DG's story and I am but the reader who appreciates her telling of it and waits in anticipation for the next the minute I put down the last.  I am drawn into the lives and experiences of each character as a voyeur who wants to participate in their every decision...how can I wait four more years.....I am hooked.

I now have all her hardback books. I hate to wait 3 years to find out what happens. Gabaldon keeps you totally engaged hanging on every word. I am not going to try to to condense this book. If you have read Diana Gabaldon before you already know what to expect. If you haven't then you are in for a treat. Be prepared to neglect everything until you get to the end.

Having watched these characters change and grow through 7 novels, reading "Blood" is like coming home. As usual, Diana's character development and story advancement are spot on, and leave you breathless for the next installment. One can only cross one's fingers that it won't be another 4 years! (Ah, well--at least there's the TV series in the meantime... :)
Fabulous book the end was especially satisfying.

I have read all of Diana Gabaldon's Outlander books in the series, and find them very entertaining!  I love the way she writes.  I only wish this book had come out sooner because I find I've forgotten a lot of the details of earlier books in the series and will have to go back and reread the whole series when I'm finished to make it all fit together completely.

Best and fastest read book ever. I loved it. I didnt want it to end. Gabaldon used a lot more Scottish speak in this book, more so then the others. I loved the way the story was wrapped up, or not, in some instances. I was not bored for one page this whole book. Im sorry but the other books were a little drawn out at times, this one was a page turner. loved it!

Great read and takes the story on very neatly. One of the things I love about this author is the attention to detail and the accuracy.  Imagine my surprise to actually find an error! :)  On page 229, she describes a horse as being a fine chestnut with a black mane. ;) That's a bay. Chestnuts cannot have black manes--they are always a shade of brown, or flaxen.

Diana Gabaldon does a great job with suspense. If you like time travel, war, action, and suspense novels this entire series will keep you on your toes. Miss Diana will take you through the historical accounts of several wars with the twist of time travel and for a kicker all for the choices of love, duty, obligation, and spinning complete out into the unknown.

Claire and Jamie's lovestory continues in the Revolutipnary War setting. Working in George Washington and Benedict Arnold was clever. We we're treated to more time travel...left hanging for another book. Can't wait--hope she'll do snother, but don't want to face losing Claire or Jamie. Gsbakdon's story lines are compelling reading--I can 't put her books down.

I loved the continuity of characters from earlier Outlander novels and their further development.  I did not especially care for the very extensive history and details of the American Revolution, although it did add to character development and introduced Denzel and Rachel.  I would recommend this book to anyone who loves historical fiction, as well as romance

Another winner in the Outlander series!  I am only 1/2 finished with the book but I am so thrilled with the next chapter in the lives of Claire and Jamie and their families!  I just can't wait to find out what is around the next corner for them.  Book after book is just as good as the previous!  I own the whole series!  Please Diana....hurry up and write more!

After reading all 8 books, I feel the author should have stopped at 6 or less.  I feel she has drawn out the story so it becomes boring.  After all the main characters have been through, one would expect a much more interesting ending.  The flash backs in the final book to modern times don't seem to have any connection to the historical pattern of the series.

The characters of this series become like your family and friends, involving yourself in their lives. Reading all 8 books back-to-back, waiting for the next book (praying there is a next book) is like having to leave behind people you care about for an unknown length of time. I look forward to being reunited with the Fraser's, characters I have grown to love.

I love this series but this book has lots of gaps. She first fails to explain how the characters are able to do the things they do when they show up in the past with nothing but can buy horses food and shelter. It is a little thin on the plots also in this installment. It was still a Good read and would have given it 5 stars if these things were done better.

I have thoroughly enjoyed this entire series. I do hope that a 9th is written but if not this one ended beautifully. I will truly miss the whole Fraser clan and will probably read the series again I enjoyed it so much. The side character stories were of course not as good as Jamie and Claire but can't say as I've read too many other stories to rival them :)

The last book of the Outlander series (so far).  I've enjoyed the entire series and highly recommend them to anyone  who isn't intimidated by large books.  In spite of their length, they have been a fast read for me.  Read the entire series in two months.  Now I can just hope that in another four years, or sooner, Diana Gabaldon will continue with a book 9.

The beginning of this book was a bit slow for me; perhaps I should have reread the last one before starting the newest.  However, by the time it was half done, I thought it was fabulous.  Having looked forward to it for a year, I was not disappointed!  I especially liked how they brought Brianna and Roger into the story.  You'll have to read it to find out!

I had looked forward to this book for six months.  It seemed to be mainly a rehash of prior material with little continuation of historic involvement by the main characters.  With the return of the daughter, son-in-law and grand children will we look forward to another not so good book ?

What can you say?  Diana makes me feel like I’m right there as if I am in the story with the characters.  I really enjoy how she takes historical figures from the past and expertly weaves them in with her characters.  It is extraordinary story telling at its best.  I love the Outlander series on Starz and very happy she waiting for Ron Moore to produce it.

Great continuance of a great saga!Diana is incredible..I take the liberty to use her first name because she has become like a great friend telling a wonderful story. My only complaint is she is a tough act to follow. I am having difficulty finding a good book to hold my interest until her next installation. Thank goodness for the Outlander series on Stars.

I love every book Diana Galbadon has ever written.  Written in My Own Heart's Blood fills in a lot of holes in the other Outlander series.  I never want her books to be over.  I have read them all several times and I know I will do the same with this one.  You can't get everything out of the book the first time your read it.  I absolutely love it.....!!!!!

Diana, I am a long-time fan but not of the Revolutionary War as detailed in this book.  What I have loved most in the past were the twists that reveal the consequences of time travel and everlasting love.  Too much historical detail and not enough creativity.  Predictable.  Weak ending.

I wouldn't call this a bad read, just be prepared for not much happening, particularly compared to several of the earlier books.  The story wasn't advanced much - events happen, without much depth.  It felt like this book was setting up for the next, presumably last, book in the series.

Waited and often wondered as to the fate of the Fraser's.  Now I'll have a longer wait to read the rest--!NOT fair.  The flow of the book keeps you on the edge of your seat and as usual, it's hard to stop reading.  Loved the book.

This was one of her best!  The last one meandered slowly along and then she threw in tons of peril at the end.  She gets  right to the cliff hanger perils in this book and it moves very fast.  Too fast!  I was very sad with how quickly I read this fabulous book.  Now we have to wait several years for the next?  Ugggh!  Hurry up Diana and get to writing!

Have waited for years for this book. Absolutely love it! Actually decided to reread all of the series again. After all, I have to wait three to four more years for the next one! This is a series of books that have been  and will continue to be shared with members of my family and friends. We are all Outlander addicts, waiting for our next "fix".

Have read all the books in the Outlander series and love them all.....this new one being no exception. It was so long between her last book in the series and this new one that I had a little trouble at first trying to remember the "connections", but she did an outstanding job tying in past events to bring the characters back to life!  Loved it!

So happy to get another Outlander book!!! Even with the time lapse I quickly remembered all the characters and events of previous novels. The writing is so good that I slowed down my reading for the last hundred pages to make it last as long as possible. I can only hope that another book will come along one day to transport me back to these characters!

She had me from the first word and the horror when I turned the last page and found I had reached the end.  Diana never fails to leave me wanting more.  I love this series, have read it multiple times and will do so again.  If you love historical novels, drama, humor, sex, and most importantly men in kilts, all of the books in this series are for you!

The long awaited follow-up was, for me, like curling up on the couch with a fire, a glass of good scotch and catching up with an old friend.  The story continues with the same grace and vibrancy as each previous novel.  As though no time has passed since finishing the last one, yet so much is unfolding along the way.  great read! ... until next time.

As always, Diana blows my mind. Some of the characters in this book, I thought were unnecessary. But more often than not, there is always a point later in the book or series that makes these relevant... so I am hoping that is the case. I love, love, love Jamie and Claire. I'm not sure how I feel about William, BUT his whole situation is challenging.

Well written in the authors strong style invoking an imaginative rendering of the historical time and place. I was drawn into the story where i saw, felt, and smelled the experiences of the characters. I was dissappointed in the ending and didn't think it was as meticulously crafted as the rest of the story. Even so, I would definitely recommend it.

I hope the author is working on the next book. The extended  family are Back on the Ridge in North Carolina . The reader is left with the desire to know the experience of Roger and Bree and what happened to William. It has been a fascinating collection of woven stories of a family over a wide time span with inclusive historical information. Bravo !

I loved every other book in the Outlander series,but this one was  boring. It was disjointed and overly long. Author could have left out half of it and  you'd never miss it. Ending was disappointing. I expected  the loose ends to be tied up ,they were not. It was not worth the wait ,that's for sure. Not sure if I should even hope for another novel.

The 8th book of the series just gets better. The wonderful characters feel like family by now and I despair at having to leave them. There are some time/date issues that I question, but the story's end is beautiful and well worth the read. I just hope the stories continue and Claire and Jamie continue their sagas. I just want the fun read to go on!

I am so happy & sad that it's over....now to wait for more! @ least they will be together...William will have to join now that he knows he has a sister! Lv this story & the narration is superb! Reading & listening is a must. Lord John Grey will have to entertain me for awhile I guess. Let the count down begin till the next installment of Outlander.
wonderful book sets the stage for next generation of the clan fraser
Great book!

Liked it, as I have all the other Outlander series books. BUT....without giving too much away the book seemed to follow two separate stories and the threads just didn't "flow" together. One thread was presented and left unmentioned again until too many chapters later. The history and customs of the times that are interwoven in these novels are always fascinating just felt like the story line was a little choppy this time
I have loved all her books.

MOBY is a nice transition book from Echo in the Bone to the next book in the series. It does lack something in drama that exists in previous books and the ending was expected by the time I came to it.
The storyline with Roger & Bree's family left me hanging with no explanation of how the ended where they did at the end of the book (no spoiler here!).  Otherwise. It was worth the wait!

After waiting for what seemed like an eternity I was excited when the book was finally released as I wanted to know the fate of several characters in the series.  After the anticipation of waiting for the next book sometimes the book can fall flat, but I am happy to say I really enjoyed my time with Claire and Jamie and the rest of the family and am looking forward to the next installment (I am hoping it wont take quite so long).

I am a very  big fan of the Outlander series and have been waiting with baited  breath for this latest release.  I have to admit that I was disappointed in that I think there is too much filler and not enough substance.  Although there is a Gray (John) in the book I don't think the author needed to feel compelled to compete with the "Shades of"; did I really need to know all of the intimate details of the wedding nights between Ian and Rachel and Dottie and the doctor?  I was happy to learn of Jem, Brianna and Roger toward the beginning of the book, but then she never got back to them again until 2/3 of the book was finished.  I am happy that the story was completed and all of the characters were satisfactorily accounted for but it is my opinion that the author was in a hurry to finish the book and that is evident.
Have always loved Ms. Gabaldon's books.  Some of the NJ locations are near my home. Interesting to imagine the battles that took place there. Feel like the characters are part of the family.

Outlander is by far my favorite series!  I have read each twice and just finished listening to the series on Audible  That being said, this is  8th book is very good, but not quite what I was hoping for. a bit too many battles.  The ending....we'll let me just say I ca't believe it ended!
As always, another wonderful read that leaves you wanting more!
I always love DG's books and have reread them many times.  My only complaint about this one is the feeling that the ending was rushed and it abruptly.

A lot of skipping pages of irrelevant stories to pad out the story (same as 5,6 & 7th book).  I always enjoy reading of Jamie, Claire, Briana, Roger etc but do not think I will buy a 9th book if it is published.

It took a long time to be released, but it was well worth the wait. It is full of adventure, suspense, tears and happiness with a few surprises for good measure. I would recommend the whole series of Diana Gabaldon's book to any one.

Been waiting for this book for ages.what a captivating story this book lived up to the others with an enthralling story. Although this could be the end of the story I hope there is another book in the pipeline.
While I have loved every book in Outlander series, this might possibly be my favorite. I was enthralled from the very first page and waiting for the next book will be excruciating.
Loved this book. The only thing was it left a lot of things unexplained. Maybe another one on the way????

I love all the Outlander series - and loved this one as well. I could hope the series goes on as following the characters whether Jamie and Claire's forever love or those of Brianna and all the other great characters like John, Hal and William is something I truly enjoy. While also feeling I'm learning something about living in the late 1700s.

Life in Ireland and linking to past experiences from the other books was well done.  While the series is always moving back and forth between time periods, the current day script was confusing.  Jem was kidnapped and Roger's family was terrorized but all of a sudden they were in America and planning on going back in time to find Roger.  I got lost in the story-line.

The first few pages I was lost. I couldn't unDees tank what was happening. Then the sunrise and we were turning pages. So many old friends and great historical texture, I felt like I was living history with loved ones in both uniforms. I am waiting ffor the next book.

Outlander #8 does tie together the loose ends, gives a review of some of the previous stories, allows us to meet some characters again, or some for the first time we 've heard about. Ends the spring of 1779.  This was the first book I've run into that synched recorded audio with written word on a kindle app ( I use my cell phone). A treat to be able to be read to occasionally by another outstanding reader who can do male, female, accents etc. very well. Synched with the words so you can go back and forth between the two. There is an extra charge for the audio.
Reading the 7th book of the outlander series is like visiting old friends. Do I have to wait 4 years for another visit with the characters?
Thoroughly enjoyed  visiting with all the characters from the Outlanders.
Great book, but would have like to hear more about Jaime.
Another can't put it down from Diana.  Please hurry with the next one. All 8 books get 5stars. Hurry PLEASE.
You just get involved like being part of the family and don't want them to end.

Awesome.  I'm sad this is the last book, but it sure was a great series.  The series has a lot to it, time travel, action, romance, and the unique perspective of it mostly taking place over 200 years ago.  Make sure you start with the first book in the series!

As with all her books, this was a great read- better than Echo in the Bone.  I love it when she writes about the family life, and Clare's  healing events.  And again she leaves me waiting to hear about the adventures of Roger and Brea, and then there is William - what next for him.  Sometimes I feel that it takes almost too much time to tell of the events of the battle day, and yet I know her attention to detail is part of what makes her books so interesting.

Another excellent story.  Too bad it takes so long between books.  There is a history intertwining all the primary characters and many of the secondary ones that sometimes gets confusing.  There should be a time line, a family tree or perhaps a brief synopsis of the previous books in this one to tie all the various threads together.  Otherwise, it great to be back with the Frasiers.
Another excellent novel. I hope it doesn't take years for the next one.
Another winner by Diana Gabaldon.
Did not care for ending of book.
Wonderful as usual!! Diana Gabaldon is my favorite writer!!!
Another win from Gabaldon!  It is one of the best.
Can't wait for the the next book

I have read all of the Outlander series books and have thoroughly enjoyed them all.  There is lots of action and her historical descriptions of the hardships of the 1700's is a way for us to see what our own ancestors endured.  She truly writes a good tale and is my favorite author.
This story just doesn't get old!  It's been well worth the wait to fall in love with these people and time.  I'm sure I'll read it many times again.  Thank you Diana.
Another amazing chapter in the outlander universe. Wish it didn't have to end. Excited for the next one.

I cried, I laughed, I cried, I smiled, I loved....amazing, amazing, amazing. I have not read such a great book beginning to end in a long time....I feel complete at the completion of this book and want to start all over again at Book 1!

Once again we are drawn into the life of Claire and Jamie  Exciting uncertain times during war and peace filled with rich characters bigger than life.  So glad the story ended with the arrival of Bree and family.  Bodes well for another adventure in the future.

Thanks again for a great read Diana! These books never feel boring or seem to drag and though I have no Scottish or English ancestry when I read an Outlander Novel I feel as if I'm reading about my ancestors. I have become attached to all of the characters and would love to meet them if I could.

Outstanding. Waiting impatiently for "Outlander," the TV series. I will have to re-read the series, while waiting for Book 9. I loved how "The Space Between," and "Written in My Own Heart's Blood," meshed.
It's a joy to encounter the Outlander family again.  The only sad part is finding yourself at the end of the book.
