Thank you Diane I don't think I could have waited any longer. As always I couldn't put the book down. I am guilt of skimming the pages with the battles only because I can't wait to get back to the dialogue between the characters. After this cliff hanger I don't know if I will be able to hold out for another 3-4 years!

Absolutley wonderful story. Very well written with a lot of attention to details. It is historically accurate making history come to life. I hated when I got to the ending...can't wait for the story to continue!!
Loved it, as I have all the previous books.  Looking forward to Book 9!!!!!!!
Loved it !! Can't wait for next book!
You'll be lost if you don't read this-so don't miss it-not as action packed as previous books and a little slower, but good in all
A wonderful continuation of the Outlander Saga! These characters embody the full range of humanity and I love immersing myself in the world Diana Gabaldon has created.
Loved catching up with Jamie and Claire.  Can't wait for the next book to see if Brianna and Roger will stay or go back home.

I've been hooked on the Outlander series since I found them 9 years ago. I read voraciously, at least two books at the same time. Needless to say with that much reading I do not like to reread books.....except for this series. It's my bi-yearly tradition. I start on Outlander and keep going until I'm done! I always find something new I've missed and love the journey Diana takes me on. Her latest book is no exception, loved it from start to finish. I made myself read slower just to prolong an already long book! The reason I call it a 'noisy read' is because for an activity that is supposed to be silent, aka reading, I find myself trying to explain to my husband or coworkers why I've  unexplainably laughed out loud....loudly, or why I just gasped, or why I was sitting in the break room talking to myself and crying. Diana is amazing in not only carrying you with her on a journey but completely encompassing you in the story, sights, sounds, and smells!  Her attention to the five sense amazes me and if the reader allows themselves to be completely immersed along with her, they will not be sorry. So 'brava' Diana and please get cracking on the next book in the series...it's going to be a very long 4 years to wait!! Also, thank you for enlivening up my literary world!
As always, I was immediately taken in to the world and back in time.  A beautifully written continuation to a wonderful story, I was sad when I made it to the last page!
Great book as always from a great author .
This is her best book in the series since the first!

I was pretty disappointed with this book. It could be that I've read all of her books (some a few times) and I'm just getting sick of the same old thing. But I felt like the storyline, plus character development was pretty thin. To compensate for lack of real development there was a lot of extraneous stuff that was just a distraction and didn't add to anything, or just unnecessarily violent/graphic. Maybe she was under a deadline, or is just burnt out. But I didn't find this to be a worthy addition to the collection.

Being addicted as I am to The Outlander series, I leave The Ridge unsatisfied, and the craving for more is stronger than ever. I am that disappointed in William's story, and there's a whole novel yet to be read about Roger and Bree and family, not to mention all the new families being born. All my questions are plot spoilers, so I will not ask them here, but it is soooo hard to wait four years for the answers. Unfortunately, this is not one of my favorite installments. The last half of the tome feels like Ms. Gabaldon threw up her hands with no clear plan, and rambled and stumbled to a dissatisfying clif-hanger......"Ridge"-hanger?!.....to be continued?
Worth the long wait, a great read, like visiting with old friends, catching up on all of the familys adventures.
it was very hard to follow...not quite as put together as all of the others.....
As always I enjoyed reading DianaGabaldons latest book,I look forward to the next one.
Wonderful! Sad the next will he years away!
Pick your descriptive adjectives, it is quite simply the book of the year.
Good, but very much like the others.

Loved this book. At first I thought that the author had been reading the dictionary to include a whole lot of words that had me looking up meanings constantly but it came right. It was back into the family that I now feel I am a member of.  I enjoyed this book more than Book 7.  Of course I am now now desperate to read Book 9. By my reckoning Jamie and Claire are still in their 50's so there are several more to go - and of course Jamie is several years younger so...................keep writing Diana.

Trouble follows Claire a.d Jamie, as well as the whole family. Which is what pulls you in and keeps you engaged. William learns about Jamie, even though it defensible everyone else knows. Then the last page just leaves you with a mix of emotions on how it ends.

As always, the latest installment in the Outlander series does not disappoint. The reader is drawn back into the storyline as if it hasn't been years since the last installment. MOBY is another page turner that resolves all of the cliffhangers  from An Echo in the Bone, and leaves you with a very solid ending that still encourages you to wonder what could possibly happen next! Gabaldon has never disappointed me yet; indeed, my only disappointment lies in knowing that it will be another 4-5 years before another "big book" comes my way. In the meantime, I'll settle for those in between projects to keep me familiar with Claire, Jamie, and the rest of the clan!
unbelievable-- as usual
I know it's morose but l often worry l won't live to read the next book. To that end these  books are like a family history.

Some of the storyline I loved and felt like the good ol' days of Outlander or Dragonfly in Amber. But at other times it was like the worst of Echo in the Bone. However, Gabaldon is a master at leaving you anxious to read the next book and this one is no exception.
As good as any of the Outlander series. Leaves an opening for further stories of Clair and Jamie's family. The mix of American history and Scots history is always entertaining.
Fantastic addition to the series... but getting tire of the Roger/Bro Saga...

I was so looking forward to reading the continued saga of Jamie and Claire and was not disappointed.  Diane Gabaldon again gave me a beautiful love story spanning many centuries.  I think this may be the end of the series with so many parts solved but in retrospect I still see the possibility for the storyline to continue with the next generation. As we have learned, time travel is in the genes!

Not much to say other than it was simply fabulous. I have read/listened to all of Diana's Outlander series books more times than I am willing to admit to. Unlike the previous book, Echo In The Bone, which left many of us diehards a wee bit unhappy/unsettled, this book had a satisfying and gentle ending. I only hope, as a woman of a certain age, that I am around for the ninth and final book of probably the finest book series written in my time. Thank you to Herself!

I'm a fully committed Outlander fan. It has made my life better and I think Diana Gabaldon is a wonderful writer but MOBY left me slightly disappointed.  It had moments of brilliance but was not up to Diana's usual standards. I can forgive this however because writing BIG books takes focus and the upcoming dramatizing of the first "Outlander" novel has been a delightful distraction for Diana (and her legion of fans). Her characters are fully developed in our hearts and minds and even if we don't always feel happy about the plot development, any additional volumes to the collection are to be treasured.
She lives up to her previous books, Great/
Dianna Gabaldon,  has written another wonderful book in the Outlander series. I would highly recommend it.  I really enjoyed reading it!  Thank you Dianna!

Yet another outstanding novel by Diana Gabaldon, she never ceases to amaze.  I am a Google addict and frequently check her references to history, which are always spot on, with a pinch of literary license. So, will we be hearing more of William in the future?
Tidyed up all the loose ends. An excellent book for the las t of the series
Eagerly awaited for a long time.  This book closes the saga of Jamie, Claire and family with all the enjoymebnt of the previous books.  Thank you, Diane
Love this series. Read the other 7 books a couple of times. Felt this book spent too much time on the war, but still enjoyed it. Will re-read at some point.

I waited a long time for Book 8.  It didn't really live up to my expectations. I love the whole family dynamic.  This book basically I felt focused more on William but not in the way you would expect it to.  This book wasn't as rich as her past books. I was somewhat disappointed.
Didn't think it was as good as past books in the series but continued the story along.
Always a good read but I have trouble keeping up with all the references to previous books.
i ha ve read all of the books  by the time a new one comes out i have forgotten some of the characters but i love the main characters and eagerly await the next one

Diana Gabaldon's latest in the Outlander series delivers more adventures of Jamie Fraser and Clare B. Randall Fraser, etc. but  few surprises. The novel left the Roger/Briana and family's episode rather up in the air. Hope there's one more to complete the story, especially the hidden treasure!
Great

The latest installment of the Fraser family was as page turning as were the other six.  Some of the same problems presented themselves and all had gratifying solutions.  There is still room for Diana Gabaldon to write another as she hasn't aged the characters much.  I appreciated the research she did on the Revolutionary War, both the battle strategies and the medical knowledge.

Loved it. My only wish was it was shorter and didn't follow so many story lines and characters. My favorite scenes is where Claire needs to deal with medical emergencies with crude resources. She is a great heroine
Not quite as good as the previous books, but still fun to see all the characters again.

I love that we revisited characters from the series throughout this book. There's finally some answers to all the unanswered questions and cliff hangers from the last book. I just wish this series would finally get wrapped up, I love these characters, they are like family, but it needs to be wrapped up already.
I was a wee bit disappointed at times, but overall  enjoyed the read - some loose ends so there has to be another!

So I'm not really sure what to say...it wasn't my favorite. I was so looking forward to this book but I was left feeling unfinished if you will. I can't imagine that this is how the entire series is going to end. Jamie and Claire's love story is one you will never forget once you've read Outlander. (Which is still my favorite) ! Everyone's opinion is different, read and enjoy.

This was certainly on a par with other books by Gabaldon.  Interesting historical interest as it took place in the time of the Revolutionary war. Her topics are timely even now.  Intermarriage, racism, homosexuality, poverty, prostitution, no one wins in a war, PTSD, and soldiers using their power against the vulnerable.  I think that she may be over dramatizing the sex scenes between Claire and Jamie at this time in their lives.  She does show that they love each other through their conversations and emotional support of each other. I find it hard to put her books down. There is always something to learn.

Love these books but I felt like the author didn't know how to end the book, so she just ended it where she was. I love the characters and the story. But after waiting 4  years for this book i must admit I was a bit disappointed.

Diana did it again!!!  If you are reading this you are already into this series and I sure don't have to sell it to anyone!  The story of Jamie and Clare reuniting after Clare believes Jamie has died and how they handle her marriage to Lord John was told perfectly!  Because it takes so long in between her books I'm glad that this one didn't end with the type of cliff hanger that her last book did.  I appreciate the fact that  Diana takes her time to write the spellbinding stories that she does, but I'm also anxious to see how things unfold between Jamie and William and also what is going on with Bree, Roger and their children.  Thank you Diana for many hours of enjoyment and escape from the daily grind of this time period to live with Jamie and Clare for a bit!!!  Can't wait for the series to start in August on Starz!!!!
Excellent  Diana is fabulous as always!
So very sad that I finished this book and now I have to wait for the next one....Diana Gabaldon! I love the way you write!

I Do not want to let any of my comments be a spoiler. I was not disappointed.  I loved I.  I read it on my kindle and also purchased the audio for my android at the same time.  I read it first. Now I will listen to it.  I read quite fast and often hear and appreciate the great descriptive style much more in listening on a long drive.  But, Diana, can we have a story without a fire?  For me that is re-running same story, different book.  I am already looking forward to the next one.
Great book  Always hankering for more

I have read most all of the novels written by Ms. Gabaldon.  I throughly enjoy the blending of the past with the future and the historical aspect of the encounters with the characters of the story.  While this story was indeed enjoyable it seemed to focus more on the sexual exploits of our hero and herione.  I thought that the development of William's character was a bit lacking.  I would assume one of his age and upbringing (stoic English) would have been a bit more mature.  I felt as if he were acting more like a 13 year old.  Overall the story has progressed very nicely and I will be waiting the next adventure.
After the long wait for this book I was NOT disappointed. I give it 5 stars +!

As i've posted before, I love this story, but the author really needs an editor (or a better one). The characters and story line are compelling and draw you in, but the story itself is choppy, making the events unclear and leaving you wondering what really happened. I often find myself skimming over overly-detailed passages of landscape, smells, medical procedures. Even if those things help you imagine the scene, I don't need three paragraphs of how people smell in the 1700's. There are often many scenes between the primary characters that are left out and only referred to. While I appreciate the ensemble cast, I'm less interested (and often very distracted) by the changing POVs. I wish she would just pick 1st or 3rd person and stick to it.  In short:  A great story that could have been told better.
I enjoyed this book, as I have all Outlander books.  Keep up the great work!!

A great addition to the series. This book has a nice mix of all of the different sets of characters and story lines. The only thing I don't like is that now I probably have to wait another five years to find out WHAT'S NEXT :)

I thoroughly enjoyed the book but thought it had some passages that were drawn out while some needed more written about it; would have liked to hear how Roger and Bree made that passage in time to be on the ridge.  Now, when can we expect the next book. Hope it isn't as long a wait as for this one.

This book totally lived up to all its predecessors.  Everything you've come to expect from Diana Gabaldon and the Outlander series...action, romance, intrigue, heartbreak, healing, love, and raw human emotion.  To say anything else would be a spoiler. :)

This is an amazing book with great detail on the Revolutionary War and the continuing drama of life at that time in America. Jamie and Claire are still caring for their extended family while trying to return to their North Carolina mountain home, while Brianna and Roger are fighting to keep their family intact between present day and 1739 Scotland. This book in the Outlander series only makes you want to read the next.
True to the Outlander Series!

Diana Gabaldon writes flawlessly! This latest installment of the Outlander series flows seamlessly. The minute you open the book you can't decide who you want to be back with more Claire and Jamie or Roger,Bree and their kids. The book takes off right where it left off. The history is so rich and exciting and the personal stories are just as if not more enticing. I don't believe in spoilers but I will say that this book keeps you connected to every story and character. I finished this book satisfied but wanting more very badly.
another brilliant book from Diana,  romance - yes, history - yes, adventure -yes. As usual, couldn't put it down and a lot of things got neglected. Great ending :)
Wonderful!  Can't wait for the last one.  War scenes and injuries a little too graphic for me but I love this series and can't wait for the TV series beginning in August.
Loved this book can't wait for the next one
Amazing! I want more

While I really love this series I found this book a little flat and not quite as exciting as the others. The crossing over of timelines makes better reading from my perspective rather than a historical reading of the revolution. I do hope there is another book that fleshes out the Rodger and Bree saga.
Amazing as always!
Loved it! Hope the wait for the next one is not too long

Wow...I really liked this book. All of the outlander series is amazing. I don't want to give away any spoilers for those that haven't read it yet.  Some questions have been answered and new ones to ponder. I can't wait for the next one. Hopefully there will be another. I am excited to learn more about William.
As good as all the ones that came before. She is an amazing story teller.
Love this book! I've read all of the Highlander series, and this continues the excellent writing that I've come to expect of Diana Gabaldon.  She knows how to tell a good story!

Written in My Own Hearts Blood is one of my favorite books of the Outlander series because it tied up Fraser family storylines in a satisfying way. It also peaked my curiosity to go back and re-read the first seven novels and the "bulge" novellas as well. Diana Gabaldon packs so much information into her extensive multi-year plots that I can read it all again and probably see new connections among all the characters across the generations.
Amazing as always.  Can't stop reading it, can't wait to find out what happens next, but want to slow down and savor it because I never want it to end!

The war and the carnage are always a bit much for me. It seemed to go on and on. But, I've accepted that is part of the series. Lord John Gray and William both bore me to tears. All of Roger and Brianna story as well as Claire and Jamie's and their families were all perfect.

Loved the book! Like I've loved all of her books! Yes there was war and violence and injuries, even death but ultimately these books are about love! This is what keeps me coming back for more! This author writes beautifully with emotion that brings you into the story! And when it's over you feel like you are saying good-bye to people you care deeply for! Until the next book! Please tell me there will be a next book? I am an avid reader and this series remains my favorite! Until we meet again!

Great read.  Finished off the saga and filled in the gaps.  Sad to think this would be the last in such a fantastic series.  Have read the whole series a number of times.  Never tire of it.  Recommend others to start at Cross Stitch (or Outlander) and become engrossed.

Full of action and wonderful storytelling. Jamie and Claire's interactions are so magical and full of sparks still...I love it. I have had a hard time getting into some of the author's previous novels but this one was easy to read and a quick read. I highly recommend!
Loved it.  I hope it doesn't take too long for the final book.
Every novel leaves me wanting more.  Now I can.'t wait for the next installment.  I find I care about the characters like family.

I have been not so patiently waiting for this book the be released. It surpassed all of my expectations. It really explained more about Ian and William as well as what happened to Jem and Roger. I can not wait for the next book in the series. Absolutely phenomenal. I LOVE the relationship of Jamie and Claire and Roger and Bree. Truly Outstanding!

Can't wait for the next book even though this one was my least favorite of the Big Books. I felt like this one lacked some of the details that the previous books had and left me hanging at the end. Obviously well written like all of the other books. Brilliant author! Imaginative and intriguing, her writing transports the reader to another time.

Superlative!!!!!! Ms. Gabaldon has done it again!!! It was well worth the wait!!! She is one very special, talented writer - and I highly recommend this book. It was very hard to put down to get some sleep, and I found myself waking up in the middle of the night just to read a little bit more! The ending??? All I can say is that tears of joy were running down my face. Fantastic writing!!!
So far I've read all the great storied of Claire and James Fraser. I can't get enough of their story and I'll be waiting anxiously for more.

I have read all of this series, and the final book is poor by comparison. Diana has depended on sexual activity and dialogue entirely too much.  It became tiresome.  She used this strategy with many characters, not just Jamie and Claire, and I lost interest.  I note that the ending leaves a huge opening for more books but I am done.

In comparison to the other books in this series, I felt the author just wanted to finish it up.  The passion that held me to the series did not seem to come across.  The book was good but disappointing.

LOVED it! Do read the series in order, though. Though the author provides brief summaries of past events, those summaries serve mostly as reminders for readers who have read the earlier books.  The main characters have evolved over decades (centuries, even, due to time travel) and a first time reader would probably be frustrated at best.
an excellent book. this one is so much better  the last one. My only question is will there be another one. it could go either way.

Fantastic writer, fictional writer of historical romance and fantasy of going to back in time through the stones in Scotland.detail of history and living in those times, best to read all her books to understand the story!! I highly recommend reading all her books!!

Diana Gabaldon takes her readers on a trek through early American History, as would be experienced by an immigrant family. As I read the story, I delighted in the integration of real American heroes into the fictional characters' lives and events. And, as with all of the Outlander books, I the Fraser family experiences captivated my attention, making it difficult to put the novel down. Loved this book. Can't wait for the next one.

Great characters but a little slow moving. I've read some of the other reviews. I like all the characters and all the story lines. If you are going to read an 800 page book, it can't be just Jamie and Claire. If she writes another one, I will still read it, but I was able to put this one down and go to sleep. The others made me ignore work and my children :). I would still recommend it to any fan.
Loved it, now I can't wait for the next one!

Everything I hoped it would be.  The only shame is that it will probably be a bunch of years before the next (and final?) book in the series is released.  Diana is an amazingly detailed writer and researches the history and culture of the times thoroughly, and that is just one of the many things that keeps this reader coming back every time anything in the series is published, whether it be one of the main series books like this one, or a Lord John book, short stories, anything.....  I've been following Jamie and Claire's saga since a friend turned me on to the series back in 2004 and even celebrated my 25th anniversary with my husband back in 2008 by spending two weeks touring Scotland by car, traveling from B&B; to B&B.;  I'm waiting with nervous anticipation for the Starz series to begin in August.  Without spoiling the ending for anyone who has not yet read or completed this book, it has a very satisfying ending that made me smile from ear to ear.  Definitely an excellent read!
Could hardly wait for this book to get here and it was well worth it. Great story; great ending. A little sad because I finished it. Can't wait for the next one!
Do I really have to wait 4 years for the next "Outlander" novel? Diana Gabeldon's is fantastic!
Hated to finish this book. Love Diana Gabaldon and her talent for description. Felt like I could see Fraser Ridge and smell the essence of life in those days.
This continuation of the Outlander series provides romance, excitement and intrigue. I couldn't put it down.

Reading this book was one of those rare times when I couldn't wait to finish to see what would happen while at the same time, I didn't want to read it for fear of finishing.  I finished and loved it more than I thought possible, and think that this is up at the top of the list of my favorite in the series.  The ending actually had me up out of my chair gasping in excitement.  I was so sad to have it end but so very excited for the continuance.
Absolutely Amazing as always

Satisfying.  Diana Gabaldon's sweeping story of time travel, romance, history and human nature keeps getting better with each book.  In this, the eighth in the Outlander series, the characters we have come to know so well are swept along by the American Revolution and acts of treachery in the twentieth century.  I fell in love with the first book in this series, Outlander, in the early 90's.  I'm hoping for at least two more.  By the way, the audiobooks, Narrated by Davina Porter, are so well done I like to read along with the audiobook.  Gabaldon and Porter are unbeatable.  Well done!

Awesome follow up in the series. Unexpected shocks which had me gasping out loud. The ending... I screamed in frustration. Can't believe I have to wait for what happens next!!! More more I want more! Can't get enough of this series!!!
Love all of the Outlander books.  Can't wait for the next one!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Should be 10 stars - absolutely brilliant. Tried to read slowly and pace myself as I knew there wouldn't be another book in the series for a few years but just couldn't help myself!  Historically accurate, characters totally believable and for the most part likable - if not lovable.  Great villains and lots of surprises. What more could a book want? READ IT!

I don't feel like that much happened  in this book. I twas good and I enjoyed it. I hope I don't have to wait two years for the next book. A tease at the end of this book, of the next book, would have been great.

If you are an Outlander fan, then you don't need much in the way of a review for this book, because you have missed Claire and Jamie just as much as I have and would be happy to read anything that continues their story. I am glad to report that this book will not disappoint you and that even though there are conflicts and tragedies embedded into the story, there are many happy events and pleasant surprises! Enjoy!
I'm afraid I'm not ready to let go and yet the book is done. I can only hope she will write more with these characters and their families as I've come to love them as mine in my own way.

It was a long four years....and when I got the book, I did not want to open it because I knew that when I did, I wouldn't be able to stop reading until I finished...but I couldn't stop myself and here I am again having to wait another few years to find out what is happening with Jaime and Claire, Lord John, William and all the rest.  THANK GOODNESS the show will start soon on Starz, but I might just have to reread several of the books again. I am hooked!

I have been reading Diane's books for over 20 years, more than once and the audio additions. Love her writing and this book was awesome, charter development is of the charts as well as the multi layered plots. Very exciting read. I could not put it down. Already can't wait for the next one...

Okay, I admit that the five stars are because I couldn't wait for the book to come out - checking obsessively at 9pm pacific time the night before the release.  It is almost everything a fan could want.  The only shortfall is that the jumping between scenes was a bit annoying.  But that is a minor annoyance to get my fill of JAMMF.

I could not put it down.  Read the whole book in about15 hrs. I love the characters.  Jaime and Claire love story continues to me enchanted and coming back for more.  Can't wait for the next book.  I love that they are back on Fraser's Ridge and that they are being reunited with Bree and family.
The characters return and fall into place as if long lost family members and old friends. Did not want it to end!!!

Ms. Gabaldon delivers once again.  The only problem is that there must be another book to tie up the loose ends of this one.  Still the adventures of Jamie and Claire are as interesting as ever and the walk-on parts by historical figures are definitely amusing.
This book was just as good as the rest of the series. She never disappoints. I can never get enough of the Fraser family! Can't wait for the next one!

I love this series, its stories and characters. I only got to know this series a year ago and have read it twice since then, that's how much I like it. This book delivers what we all want, but it also delivers scenes and plots that seem to really go nowhere or serve any purpose. Also, how many times are the main characters almost going to die and/or start their lives all over again and/or suffer some awful ordeal?. I think that Diana can deliver an awesome ending to this saga and I believe she needs to do it in the next book or it's going to start being repetitive and too fantastical for us to keep cheering on and get sucked in to the stories as we've done until now.

Diana abandon has done it again, another fantastic read. Can't wait for the next one. It was so much easier reading on my kindle as the books are usually so big.  Jamie an Claire still the ideal role models with family members taking on their moralistic traits which is not seen a lot in today's society.
We waited for so long to return to our Frasier Family. I loved the book but the ending left me frustrated. Would have liked to have had a little more of the final focus.

As highly anticipated as this book was for me, it certainly did not fail to entertain. In reading, I felt as if I were visiting old friends and making a few new ones along the way. I recommend this to anyone who has had the pleasure of enjoying other books in the series.
Diana Gabaldon just keeps getting better. I love reading her books because it's like catching up with old friends you haven't seen in a few years. Fantastic addition to the outlander series.

Loved the book. I love the entire series...though it seemed to end rather abruptly as If Ms. Galbadon was ready to finish it ASAP. I hope to read more of this saga, however it did tie up enough story lines to be a satisfying completion.  Thank you Diana.
I hated for it to end.

This series of novels is well worth reading. The novel keeps you involved in all of the characters and their lives as  well as their interactions. If you like history and time travel stories you will love this book. I can't wait for the next book.
As always, the book transports the reader to a place of rich historical experience, lovely characters, and a wish to keep going with the story...
I didn't want to get to the end!!
A disappointing book, after waiting so long!  I wonder if I will live long enough to see the end of the series!
My favorite books of all time are from Diana Gabaldon and this is no exception
I waited patiently for this book and was not disappointed!  When can we expect the next one?  I have recommended  this series to a lot of  friends!
I've loved this entire series, but MOBY did not disappoint. I was engaged the entire way and was so sad to see the last page.

This book was worth the wait! Having read the first seven books in this series, it was hard to wait. This one has it all- logical plot, strong historical background, and lots of Claire/Jamie romance, too.

Gabaldon does not let you down! There were a couple of loose end that were left dangling that I am hoping will be the beginning of the next series. If it was just too much to add to this book, I wish she had left it put completely. All in all a great read!

After the last book I really felt like the series that I loved so much had just dwindled and fallen apart. I was so disappointed I almost didn't read  MOBY but I'm so glad I did. My love for these characters was rekindled and now I'm just grumpy I have to wait years for the next.

I was a little confused remembering where and how some people fit in even though I just retread the entire series. Looking forward already for the next one. I'll retread all the others a couple of times before then

Liked the different stories in different time zones. Feel like I have become more acquainted with Ian. Mystery as to where Williams story is going. Again, it is all about the characters, like they are old friends.  Getting me psyched for the mini series.
Enjoyed the book as always, but found the ending lacking
Another deliciously think slice of the Jamie and Claire adventure. Would that it were longer or the wait between books were smaller!

I've read all the books in this series.  I found some difficulty in keeping up with the characters in this one.  I liked them better when they lived in N.C.  I found the family tree at the end of my e-book.  Would have appreciated it up front.  I established a relationship with the main characters but was disappointed that the family did not reunite until the end of the book.  I do hope there will be at least one more in this series.

First of all, I waited 4 long years for this and I'm sure will wait 4 more for the next.  The main reason I love these books, though, which is the time travel aspect, was fairly absent in this book.  Brianna and Roger's story was good (the best part really imo) but short in this one.  Instead there was a lot of the war and Claire's medical procedures and a LOT of side characters and their stories.  I didn't feel like we got enough of Jamie, Briana, Jem... and when the ending came, I was ready for the story to begin there instead!  I'm sure some things can be resolved in the next book!  I'm okay with having favorite ones in the series and this just won't be the one!
I enjoyed the book.  I hope the tv series can hold a candle to these wonderful books. I'm looking forward to the next chapter.
I loved this book. I originally thought it was the last in the series but I am more than happy to keep reading until the end..

Like a lot of people I love the Outlander series and have been looking forward to this book coming out for the past year.  I enjoyed reading it but it left a lot of unresolved issues (William for example), I guess this leaves us waiting another couple of years for the next book.  Looking forward to the TV series.

I was a bit disappointed in the ending.  I kept waiting for development of Brianna and her family's part of the story - and it did not happen.  I also could not figure out the time frame for the ending.  I thought the ending was very confusing.  Other than that, I loved the book and history of the Revolutionary War.

Personally I found a good bit of the book a bit boring what with all the drudgery of battles and at least two hundred pages describing the events of a matter of days. BUT, I love this series so much and these characters speak to my heart so. There are so many moments, conversations and incidents that make the story so rich. Claire and Jamie, Brianna and Roger, Ian and Rachel (and Rollo), Fergus and Marsali and the children...not just characters in a story. They feel like friends. These are the kinds of books that you can pick up and read over and over again when you start to miss the people and the tapestry of their lives.

Book is wonderful as are all the "Outlander" series.  On this book the Whispersync sucks.  This is the first time I have ever been disappointed with the Whispersync add-on.  If you have're tried Whispersync you should, it adds more to your experience than I can verbalize. That's why I am so disappointed with it this time
Diana, as usual, is excellent!  Can't wait for the Shotime series!

This long awaited sequel was better than I expected. While there were a few cringe-worthy bits (as always) - or should I say "bites" (never did get that part) - on the whole the story was engaging and I liked the introduction of some new characters and the development of others like Germaine. Roger has somewhat redeemed himself from the annoying wuss he was in earlier books - and Bree has developed beyond her one-note narcissistic personality. William's odd rigidity about Jamie juxtaposed to his care for Jane and Fanny was an interesting psychological twist that I hope is explored in the future.

Great to have Jamie and Claire back again!  As soon as the book was available, I began reading and was engaged all the way through.  In fact, I was surprised to have reached the end, not because of an abrupt end to the story (there isn't), but because I was so engrossed.  I am glad to know there will be one more volume (hopefully!), albeit years out.  I can wait!

I've loved these books and these characters for most of my life, and eagerly awaited the release of this book. Although I'm thrilled that it appears the series is going to continue, I was hoping for a bit more meat in the story line from this book. And I fervently hope the next one comes out soon!
Excellent sequel to all the other Oulander novels.  This one kept my attention through all the twists and turns.  Maybe time to re-read all the stories?
It wasn't as good as her previous books in the series.

After wAiting so long for each book in this series to be written published I find that I reread them all again before each new book. And enjoy then just as much each time. I'm sure everybody has their favourite bits. Mine are the descriptions of Claire's doctoring and patients afflictions. I think I read this book this time too fast. By the time I got to  the last few chapters seemed slow but I think maybe my brain had gotten to the point of saturation. So I shall wait a few months and read it again. That is the only reason I gave it 4 stars. Another wonderful read Diana Gabaldon!
I had been looking forward to this read for SO LONG.  Once again, D.G NAILS it. I only hated how it ended!!
A bit,of a let down.  Read all of,her books. This one when it was released.  Alas. Can not remember much of it!
I am going to get right to the point....LOVED IT!!! NOW I am sure there is going to be a book 9.

If this was a stand-alone book I might give it 4 or even 5 stars. I enjoy reading Diana Gabaldon's books, and like all of them, this one is well-written and full of romance and drama. But as a series installment it left me longing for much more in the way of storyline development. Like many others, I have long waited and looked forward to reading the next installment of the saga of Jamie and Claire, et al. But, like the last book, almost nothing actually happened to move things along. Clearly, Ms.Gabaldon has done her homework on the American Revolutionary war, and on medical procedures and their performance under primitive conditions but with the aid of Claire's 20th-century medical knowledge, but I'm much more interested in seeing where this story is actually headed--if indeed it is headed anywhere! What does the future hold for our characters? Will they live out their days in the 18th century? Will they come back through the stones one last time bringing Jamie with them? I'd really like to see how Jamie reacts to 20th century life. We've been given hints that he can envision it. So, could he handle it? Would he enjoy it? marvel at it? or long for his own time? This series of books is beginning to remind me uncomfortably of the 6 years I devoted to the Lost TV show which had many interesting story lines that ended up going no where and which didn't so much conclude as finally just stop, leaving so many questions unanswered. I do hope Gabaldon has an endgame--a conclusion to this story. Yes, we readers can make up our own ending(s), but I hope that's not the plan. I want to know how our author sees things working out. And I hope it won't take 8 more books to get there.

This book is a really good read.  It starts off again with my favorite characters of all times. It has twists and turns that could only be written by Diana. Kudos to you for once again putting out there another masterpiece.  Can't wait for the next in the series! Congratulations!
Good story as usual, couldn't put it down.  Satisfying ending but still wanting more.  Dare we hope for another book?

After waiting years for this next book I'll say I was a little disappointed. I found myself skimming in places.  I feel not much really happened in the book even though there are over 800 pages.  However I'm once again waiting anxiously for the next book. I can't get enough of Jamie and Claire.
I have enjoyed the  outlander series and this book was good but feel that it dragged in sections and ends  abruptly.  May be time to wind it up if there is a future book.

I believe this may be the end of this epic set of stories, with great history and family relationships in time travel.  Loved every one of these but the whole set is hours and hours and hours.... of a wonderful read.
She's done it again... amazing. I read the whole book in 4 days, could not put it down!
Awesome!
Great read.
Loved it, can't wait for the next book!!!
Perfect!
The familiar characters are all there. Her knowledge of American History is well woven throughout.  The kindle version is a lot different than holding a hard copy book but I am adjusting.

I was mostly pleased with the way the story went, however, the wrap up of Bree's family although predictable left too much to be imagined. Also, Jamie and Williams relationship could have evolved more as well as where he and Lord John left off. Opens it up for another chapter? Was this the intention?

This rating was easy to choose , as Ms. Gabaldon doesn't write bad books. It takes us back to our beloved friends, informs and entertains us,comforting us with the fact that their story is not yet over.Once again , thank you for a wonderful read!
Please hurry with the next book!! I can hardly wait. I love this series and can not wait for the starz series to begin so I can relive it!
as riveting as the rest of the books in the series! Ends well but leaves me wanting more (of course!!)
I have been in love with this series since reading the very first book and I have yet to be disappointed.  The hardest part is always the wait for the next book to come out!
I know it needed to tie up a lot of loose ends but left a lot of things hanging.  If this is the end of the series, and I hope not, I felt a little cheated
Excellent, as all of DG's books are. Live the characters. Even the minor characters stick with you LNG after you put the book down. Now the long wait for the next installment begins...

Love this series of books.  Mrs Gabaldon has the ability to keep you on the edge of your seat while giving you a glimpse into history with likeable and very realistic characters.  I've been anxiously waiting for this book and cannot put it down.

Yes, I'm an admitted Outlander addict. Reading this book fueled the craving, so much so that I dreamed about the characters after staying up reading until midnight, only putting it down when my eyes closed against my wishes.

It is impossible to low-rate an "Outlander" book. I've been reading them and rereading them for 20 years. The problem may be that Ms. Gabaldon is so wickedly successful that her editors have been given the word by the money men : don't f*** with Diana's books. So, what has slowly, and finally, come about are rambling, disconnected chapters with narrative points of view that can't be justified. Why tell this chapter from the omniscient POV?  Why this one from limited?  Does Ms. Gabaldon give the narrative POV much thought or is the choice from a flip of the coin?  Aside from that . . . . Of course I'll keep reading!!!  I don't think it's a spoiler to mention that I get a kick out of Gabaldon's blending real historical characters *as well as* famous fictional characters into the stories' narratives, or that her tales often send me scrambling ti Wikipedia to read about the battles and historical figures that pop up.

I've loved every book in this series. Another successful addition that I couldn't put down. So many books, so many pages - quality and depth in this one just as good as the first. Don't know how I'm going to wait patiently for the next one!
Written in my own hearts blood by Diana Gabaldon.  The adventures of Claire, Jamie, Ian, Bree, Roger, the kids and all the rest continues!!! Fantastic!!! Worth the wait! I love this series!!!

Another fantastic book, Diana! Could not put it down! Twists, turns and events that flat-out gobsmacked me... tears of sorrow and of joy... Going back now to retread it, slower this time, to savor the many nuances I missed the first time. Thank you for creating characters that enter the brain but live in the heart!

To say I am in love with this series would be a grievous understatement. The characters have become like family. The inclusion in a fictional way of the true events in early America makes the book and history fascinating. Basically I just love it.
I really loved this book - I have been waiting for it in great anticipation and it didn't disappoint. Thankyou
as always...left me wanting more I can't wait for the next installment.  Hopefully, it won't take too long. Fabulous series.

Once again blown away by an amazing story. I recommend this series to EVERYONE who enjoys good characters, nice love stories, epic battle scenes, high political intrigue, medical mysteries/miracles, and gripping history.

I've read the 'Outlander' series for approximately 20 years, and this is by far my favorite.  It goes fast, so clear your schedule, strap yourself in and hang on.  And don't you dare read them out of order...you've got to start at the beginning.  Can't wait for the Starz series.  Tulach Ard, y'all!

Really enjoyed this book- have been a devoted fan of the series for years now. Unlike other readers, I loved the Brianna and Roger storyline and thought it really added to the book. I am also delighted that Diana appears to have quit writing long letters in archaic English 'from the field' as I found them boring and hard to understand!

I was afraid to read this as the previous book let you hanging. It is hard to hang for the 4 years it takes to write the next book. I loved this book and it allows me to wait until the next book comes out.  Great job.
As usual a Beautifully told story in this the eighth edition in the Outlander Series, looking forward to book number nine in four years time.
Diana Gabaldon has done it again with this latest entry into the saga of Jamie and Claire.  The cliff-hanger at the end will leave you wanting more!  Loved it!
"Herself" has done it again! Completely captivating from beginning to end. Even amidst the certain heartache I found so much joy in reconnecting with these much loved characters
There was no question in my mind that, having read and loved beyond words the previous seven, I would love this one also. Positively fabulous!

although i read this book quite avidly, i was somewhat disappointed.  it seemed to jump around a lot and didnt really go anywhere.  a whole lot of war descriptions and medical procedures.  the story ended with a definite continuation needed.  i think her other books in the series were better.  this one didnt seem to have the depth in it.  however, if you have read the rest of the series, you wont want to miss this one as it will launch you into the next book that surely has to come.

Diana does it again. She gives you an 800 page book and leaves you wanting so much more of these beloved characters. You never want to leave them. It's wonderful to spend time with them again, like old friends who you can always call upon when in need. You get lost in the history, so visual, so brutal, yet so romantic. Love this series!

I really love the series...and this was a good book, but for me the flow was off.  The constant switching between characters made it hard to focus on just who the main characters are now.  I love all of the characters but I felt that more should have been focused on Jaime and Clare.  I hope it won't be another 4 years before we see another book.

Great  book I enjoyed every  minute of it.  The  story will continue they live on in our imaginations . My only fear is that at 74yrs I may not be around to read the next one.  THE author has great talent .  If you liked her other books  you will love this one.
Well worth the wait. Looking forward to the next book. I would and have recommended this and all the Outlander books to all my family and friends. Five stars is not enough.

Diana has done it again. There is never a dull moment in the lives of Jamie and Claire. Not to mention William, Ian, Bree, Rodger, Fergus, Lord John, and all the rest of the cast of characters. A roller coaster of emotions in this book will have you laughing out loud one minute and crying the next. I can't wait to find out what happens next (but I know I will have to).

"WRITTEN IN MY OWN HEART'S BLOOD"  As always, I felt as though I was one of the characters.  Screaming "LOOK OUT!!" or " WHERE IN THE WORLD WILL THEY FIND ANOTHER GEMSTONE?"  DG had me hooked from the time Jamie uttered the phrase "Well, no, so long as it doesna bother you that I am."  DG , you were behind my first trip to Scotland in 1997 (which I thoroughly enjoyed).  Each book in the series is exceptional and look forward to the next one.
Amazing book as usual I was not let down and now waiting in anticipation for the next book let alone the series to begin!
Well worth the wait. Thought I would take it slow and make it last, but finished in two days! Now I will read the series from start to finish and wait for the next book from this amazing author.
I am always torn between reading quickly to find out what will happen and sadness when it is over because I read too quickly!  Can't wait for the TV series to begin.
Love these stories. Full of emotion and detail. Can't wait for the next one. Bring it on. Three cheers Diane.
Excellent read as usual from author.  As much accurate history as possible but still personal.  Always leaves you waiting for the next installment in the saga.

Diana outdid herself with this book! Not only do we get Jamie and Claire back together we begin to see many other plot lines take shape leaving the door wide open for book #9! I just hope it won't take four or five years to write! I adore her writing....always have...always will. She writes with such depth I have yet to find another author who can compare!
I love this series.  The characters are family.  This book was perfect and I think its the best follow-up to Outlander.  Bravo Ms. Gabaldon!

I'll admit to a fair bit of frustration with the end of the previous book, but this one was well worth the wait. If this book is the last in the series, I will be satisfied. If course, I won't complain if Diana Gabaldon wrote a few more, either.

Diana Gabaldon has once again hit a home run. She is a superb writer and stays true to her characters. I am currently rereading this book because I gulped it down the first time. She makes you think about how life was during that time period and makes it come alive. I recommend the whole series, these are not just historical romance novels, they are a fantastic good read.

Another fantastic outlander story! I love the historical context of these stories. I recommend this series to everyone as the best I've ever read. My only complaint is that I have to wait so long in between books!
Another great addition to a fantastic series.Now I cannot wait for the next one-but these books are absolutely worth the wait!
I loved how the book ended and just know that the next will be as anxiously awaited as this one!

I was not disappointed in the ending of the wonderful "outlander" series.  I wish there was another book to look forward to, but all good things come to an end.  A big thank you to Diana Gabaldon for writing the series and I will be looking forward to any future stories she cares to write.  It would be fun to see what William gets up to as well as Lord John.

I MUST do an immediate 're-read, it was over too quickly! As with all of Herselfs works, I love it. This work is no different. The stories move seamlessly together and before you realize it, you're at the end!!
I am so happy that I finally got to read the last book. Have read them all now and will continue to reread them im sure many more times. Thank Ms Gabaldon for the pleasure of reading your work.

Finally after waiting 3 or 4 years for this book to be written and published, I was not disappointed!  Diana has done a wonderful job and I always so amazed with the way she takes you to scene and the reader is able to smell, taste, and live the vignettes along with Clair and Jamie.  Through Clair's eyes, I felt like I was amongst the chaos of what surely happened before, during, and after the revolutionary battles.  Diana's research, attention to detail, and ability to take the reader to the action,through words, is amazing.  I am addicted to the ongoing saga, but I expected to find the reason for Jaimie's ghostly appearance or foreshadowing in front of the 1945 Scottish bed and breakfast that dark and stormy night.

Loved this book, too!  Jamie and Claire, Ian and Rachel, Roger and Brianna, Denny and Dottie, Lord John and William!!  Diana Gabaldon has grabbed me again and transplanted me into the Revolutionary War!  Time travel seems to be a natural phenomena for a few lucky (?) people in this world...Diana makes it seem so doable!  I can't wait for the next book to see how this epic family continues to grow!

As a long time fan of this series, I am always amazed at the details, and the extensive research that Ms.Gabaldon does to continue this amazing story.  As usual, her characters are real, Claire and Jamie are aging, and the lessons that they are still learning about life and each other continues.  We have been left again with multiple questions to be answered in the next installment.  The only problem for me is waiting for three years for those answers.  It's a great series, I'll just read through it all again!
Claire and Co. continue to entertain, educate and enthrall. Waiting between books is justified based on the finished product. Amazing!
Super....can't wait to read the next installment! Gabaldon has tied history neatly into the lives of Claire and Jamie Fraser.

I could not put it down! The tapestry Diana Gabaldon weaves is colorful and complex! She illustrates the complexity of the revolutionary period in America so effortlessly through the challenges and triumphs of these beloved characters.
This book is absolutely fabulous!! I am so sad that is over and I eagerly await the next one. Amazing read!!!!!

I have waited for this book for what seems like forever and it does not disappoint.  Ms. Gabaldon has continued to make the Frasers a living entity.  She brings us up to date on their family and followed them through their travels for all of her books and now hopefully leaves them peacefully where they belong.  She gives a decent account of the battle of Monmouth and the ugliness of war.  As always she entertains.  This was not put down until I was finished and it is difficult to work and read at the same time I assure you. But I hope the journey is complete and I entreat all of you to follow though with the Frasers. It is a great read!  As always!

Along with many others, I waited for MOBY to come out.  When I learned it had been delayed, I re-read the series, hoping it would tide me over. Had I not done so, I may have found that I liked the book better. MOBY is written as a stand alone book, with explanations of who people are and back story on what happens. I found this to be distracting, but had I not read the others, I am sure I would have needed it. I feel that some of the description and detail found in the earlier books was glossed over and I missed that. Still, it is an excellent read and I recommend it to anyone who enjoys historical fiction with a twist.
Once again Diana has done a brilliant job! One of the few series that has taken me on an emotional roller coaster. Love MOBY and I'm looking forward to more.

This novel, for which D. Gabaldon fans have waited so long, is just what we were hoping it would be.  All our favorite Scots, English Lords, Dukes and others are back in this installment, which largely takes place during the Revolutionary War battles in NJ.  While Gabaldon's "fill in" short stories and novellas are OK, this epic is much more to my liking because I get so engrossed and don't want the story to end.  Well done, Ms. Gabaldon. Please don't stop!

Once again Herself has worked her magic.  I laughed, I cried, and I loved every single minute of it.  Now that I've read it at top speed because I just had to know what happened, I'm reading it again in a slow leisurely fashion, enjoying every single page.  Thank you Diana for such a wonderful series.
It seems like forever since the last book and I'm almost finished with this one -- can't put it down.  I wonder when the next installment is due.

The only thing I found disappointing about this book is that I have to wait 3-4 years for the next one!!  Diana has such a wonderful enchanting way of writing that you have to remind yourself that these characters are not real!  I have read Written in my Own Hearts Blood once, am going to read it a second time, than start the series over (again)!  This series is fiction but between the actual historical facts she incorporates and the believability of the characters and their trials and tribulations it's almost hard to accept the fact that these wonderful books didn't actually happen!  You laugh out loud, you cry, you fear for the characters as well as rejoice with them.  I can't wait till the next book and yet I'm saddened that it may be the last😊😢!
It was well written,as they all are. It tugged the heart strings and reinforces a love story for all time. Historically interesting, I can't wait for the next one!!
I love the story line and the characters so had really looked forward to the book coming out. Am awaiting the next novel to see it it explains the timelines a little better.
Too long between books.  This one has so very many plot twists it is amazing.  I cannot wait for the next one.

I started this series about 4 yrs ago and the wait for this book seemed forever. Now that I read this and again we are waiting to find out what happens to everybody. I hope the next book comes sooner than 4-5 yrs. And I hope shes not putting more effort in the Tv series and not the books. Sorry I sound greedy but I would like to know what happens in the ending in less than 5-10 years. But still a good story.

I have read all the Diana Gabaldon novels and this is just as good as the ones before it. I love Jamie Fraser and Claire. The books are long and I want to keep reading forever. I never get tired of the story. This is book 8 in the series and can't wait for the next one.
Kept me reading non-stop to the very last line!  The history of Scotland and America came to life. Time travel was the added bonus.

Wow, I have no words to describe ... the book was wonderful it was worth the wait. I enjoyed meeting all the characters from the previous books despite the advanced age of Jamie and Claire the are still vital and in love. Especially enjoyed reading their scenes and of course Ian and Rachel and the emotional meeting thst I can only imagine in my head with Brianna. This series just excellent and I can not stop reading it!!!!

Even as each page I turned of this book that got me closer to the end of this story, I knew I wanted more. The way all of Diana's books are written draws you into the story of these peoples's lives. You believe you are there with them throughout the ages depicted! Well done, awaiting more...?!

5 stars as usual. Missing Jamie & Claire & co already and I only finished the book 2 minutes ago. Another 4 v-e-r-y long years until the next one. Thanks Diana for keeping me hooked, yet again. You are a genius!
I've always enjoyed reading your books. I am now looking forward to the next one. I also can't wait for the series to start on Starz
Once again Mrs. Gabaldon has out done herself!! Love every sentence in this book! If you haven't  read this series you're missing out on something very special.
Diana is my all time favorite author.  This episode does not let those of us who wait between books down!
So glad this finally made it to the shelves, and I can say the only thing it was missing was an excerpt from the __next__ Big Book. Thanks  Diana!
Wow! I am in awe. I lived in the late 18th century for the last 2 weeks and loved every minute!

Granted these books are long. But, this one in particular was worth the wait for the ending! I'm not a weeper, and I had tears in my eyes. There is along the way some tragedy, but life was hard back then. The way the ties are written between characters, reminds you not all family is blood kin.
This is the eighth book of the wildly famous Outlander series written by Diana Gabaldon. It is possibly the most anticipated book in the world. It is a must read.

I just love these characters and the adventure that they live. Their experiences as they negotiate the Revolutionary War are gut wrenching . Returning to their chosen home in North Carolina is a new beginning with great promise as revealed on the last page. As usual, the story ceases before one wants it to. Now to dream of the next book . I hope the author is working on the continuation right now.
Great continuation of wonderful story. I hope there is more but if this is I am pleased with the way it ends
The latest installment in the Outlander Series is a fantastic read - like all of the previous books. You must read them in order but all are great. Can't wait for book nine now!

I liked the way the ending was written. It was a 'feel good' ending and left me smiling for a few days. That's the way I like it. Of course, the whole book was very well done.  Diana Gabaldon doesn't do mediocre.

Everything about this book is excellent.  In the last volume,  I found myself skipping over some of the parts about William because they just didn't catch my interest.  In this one,  the entire story was interesting.  The end was very satisfying with no frustrating cliff hangers.  The story felt complete to me,  as if the series had come to a comfortable ending.  Happily,  Ms. Gabaldon had assured her fans that there will be at least one more volume.  Sadly,  there will most likely be a 3-4 year wait for it.

Gabaldon is a good author. Her characters are real, you can identify with them, their feelings and emotions are very real. The history and culture of the times and areas they live in is accurate and believable. There is something about her books that draws you in and you don't want the book to end. I highly recommend not only this book but this entire series.

It's not pleasant waiting four long years for a new Outlander tome.  I love them so!  There is no character like Jamie Fraser.  Every woman I know who is a devotee of Gabaldon s books, is in lust and love with Himself! Claire is an amazing woman.  Together these two light up the pages.  I am grateful for my Kindle so I don't have to carry this huge book around.  Now I have to wait again.  So sad!!

Her books are just so full of twists and turns and the characters are full of depth. A fan since the first book, I read each one knowing I should savor each page as it will be a long time before the next one, but I just can't put them down!

Like the rest of the Overlander series it is superbly written. The story line goes on and keeps you spellbound. The history attached to the novel gives one an insight as to living conditions of the time. Can't wait for the next episode.
I've been waiting for 4 years and then I was done in 2 days. I would be mad if it wasn't so awesome! Now to wait another 4 years for the next.
I waited 5 years for book 8 and Diana did not disappoint. I just hope I don't have to wait another 5 for book 9.......Bring on the Outlander series Starz!
It seemed like forever for the release and I read much too fast.  Enjoyed it, only complaint is now I have till the next one.
I absolutely love this series and was so excited to read this last book....I wanted it to go on forever. What a splendid story teller she is!
Another in a great series of books, MOBY continues the readers love affair with Jamie & Claire Fraser & their family thru time.  Love it!!
I will miss Claire and Jamie, but Diana did not disappoint me in the way she wrapped up their story.
LOVED IT!  Jamie and Claire. Ian and Rachel. Fergus and Marsali. Germaine.  Jem and Mandy.  Roger and Bree.  So much going on and even at 1200+ pages I didn't want it to end!

Diana is the ultimate storyteller. I have been reading her books since 1992 and they are always excellent. The four years between her Outlander series are long in waiting for the next book, but worth waiting for. Her stories have left others wanting in comparison.

More American history and more Fraser family"fun"'.  Enjoyed it from start to finish BUT surely Ms. Gabaldon has another volume coming down the pipe?  I'm certainly happy for the family reunion; however, am even more  curious to find out how Roger and Bree & children went from 1739 Scotland to 1770's America.
As usual FABULOUS !! Well written great story line. I only wish we didn't have to wait another 3 years for the next one!!

I couldn't wait for this book to come out as it's the final book of The Outlander series.  I read it over 3 days!  Now I'm having withdrawals without Jamie and Claire in my life!  The book deals with a lot of characters and eventually brings it all to a conclusion.  I have a feeling there could be a future book, as all Outlander fans never get tired of reading about this large extended family. The one question that didn't get answered for me was - the first Outlander book where Jamie appears as a ghost in 1945 and stands on a street looking up at Claire in a window.  I thought that would be explained in the final book.  I loved the way the book ended .. but it left me wanting more!
I wish it could just keep on going. Another excellent read. It was like seeing and being with family again.
Love this book! I was so sad when I finished it, but I'll re-read like I always do along with the rest of the series

As with the other Outlander Novels, this one did not fail to keep my interest. Diana Gabaldon is an excellent storyteller and this novel brings Jamie and Claire smack dab into the American Revolutionary War.  She has expertly kept a very engaging story line while also tying up loose ends.  There are a couple of tangents that could conceivably lead to another novella or two. I highly recommend this book and, if you haven't read any of the Outlander series, I recommend that you begin with "Outlander" and work your way through the lot.  I have also purchased these as audio books so that I can continue to "read" while working through housework, gardening and other necessary tasks. This was money well-spent.
Loved it and now I can't wait for book nine.  Finally starting to answer some of the questions but left a few more.  Very enjoyable series to read.

I am sure all of Diana Gabaldon fans are just as pleased with this novel as the previous ones!  I am somewhat sad that I don't have any clue as to when another book will be done in this series...........I love reading all her Outlander books.
More coherent for the most part then Echo in the Bone. Less jumping around. Happily thereis still room for sequels given some interesting new characters.

It seemed like I waited forever for this book to come out!  I loved this installment in the series.  It has all the elements I love from the previous Outlander novels.  Like a great dessert, I tried to slowly savor it and instead made my way through it too quickly.  This moved the Frasier story along nicely and left a lump in my throat at the last few pages.  My only disappointment is that I finished it and have to wait for the next installment.  I both love you and hate you Diana.  Love you and this story so much and hate the fact I now have to wait to find out what happens.

This book was so long in coming I had to re-read the last one to remember what was going on. Well worth it. Newest is best since the original Outlander. Fast paced and emotionally satisfying. I'm looking forward to the next one and hope it's a shorter wait.
The best yet of the Outlander books, but now the long wait for the next one in 3-5 years to find out what else happened that did not get in to the book this time.  Sigh.

There are a lot of copycats out there now writing time travel books, but Diana is -hands down- the best.  She's the best because she's a great writer, period.  Her character development, gift of dialog, and her story telling ability is magical.  I think her greatest gift, however, is her ability to somehow call you into the story so that you are a part of it.  When you read her novels - any of them - your own life fades to shades of grey, and those people in her story become your boon companions.  When the novel is finished, you want to howl in frustration because YOU WON'T KNOW WHAT'S NEXT FOR 4 YEARS!  My parents were afraid they'd die before this last one was published.  Thank you Diana for entertaining me so thoroughly.
Another amazing book by an amazing author! Diana always delivers!! I can't wait for the release of book nine and hope there's a book ten too!

I was glad to finally get to read this book. I waited four years I believe for this latest novel. I fell in love with ?Jamie and Claire from the very first book. This one brings some of the story to closure but leaves you asking for more.

I am most pleased with this and probably the last of Gabaldans time traveling books. I have loved them from the beginning because she makes it more logical than others ( if time travel can be logical) . I have loved the family Fraser and the simple life we all crave.

Diana Gabaldon hit another out of the park and the best news is that she is not done with this series. We can look forward to more adventures of our favorite characters who move through their revolutionary times written with historical richness that my seventh trip to Philadelphia seems wholly different this time. Give yourself time to meet Claire, Jamie, Bree, Roger, Ian and more.
I love all her books. This one is both heart breaking & hopeful. It makes me think Jamie & Claire may give us more stories!

The characters are what make Diana Gabaldon's stories so vivid and engaging. They are real, with flaws, and we love them for it. MOBY has continued the story, given us more time with the characters we love, introduced new characters, and woven them all together. This is a wonderful next chapter in all of the characters lives, and I will now wait patiently for the next parts of their stories. Loved this book!

This was one of her best books in the series.  It flowed smoothly, yet it  continues to evolve many of her characters in their lives.  We do learn more about lord John and actually his strengths.  We continue to live with Claire and Jamie on their journey and see their love and respect for each other grow. I found it an easy read and mellow even with the continued development of each characters lives. Can there be more. Always. I am thankful to have come to the point in life if the characters that she has brought us too. Great  book and series
Again I have been taken from joy to sorrow and back to joy.  A great read and I think I am going back to the beginning and starting again,  Well done Diana.
Gabaldon's books are always amazing but this one, which ties up some serious loose ends from in the previous books, goes above and beyond her usual quality. My favourite next to Outlander.
After waiting for what felt like forever for this book I had high expectations and I am please to say I wasn't let down.  I loved it.

Her story telling is fabulous, but her cast of characters could have used another 400 to 500 pages as there are so many loose ends that it's an agony waiting for the next installment, which in her own words will be another 4 years in the making.
The hardest part was taking my time reading it and not reading within a 2 day period! A great addition to the series!
Well worth the wait but now I'll need 4 more years till the next one. Only 2 historical inaccuracies. Great fun!
This is rated 5  Hope there is more coming.  It is such a teaser .  Did Roger an Brianna get back together and how and was that that them on the wagon?  I can't wait to find out.
So worth the wait. Great writing, true to character, and vastly entertaining. The writing is refreshingly good; witty, yet subtly poignant.
It is my sorrow to find myself at the end of the series, if that's what it is. Thanks  Diana for every emotion you evoked in me. I will continue to 're-read and enjoy.

This whole series is outstanding.  Diana brings all her characters to life.  She creates such a vivid gripping story that you can't help but fall in love with it and the characters.  I love to read them again and again!  Each book has the potential to make you laugh out loud, cry your eyes out, and go weak in the knees and a whole lot more.
She has done it again! Diana Gabaldon is a wonderful historic novel writer. She always leaves you wanting more and I cannot wait for the next one. Just hope she is working on it now.
Loved it.  But oh my  do I really have to wait 5 yrs for the next one?  Guess I will reread all the "Outlander" series again
I waited so long for it, and it lived up to all my expectations.  I only wish it were longer.
But now I'm a little sad. It is over and now what am I going to read? I guess I will just have to move on with my life...

In this eighth but not last in Diana Gabaldon's historic Outlander series, we finally learn Jem's fate, how William comes to grips with the truth about his parentage, Ian's love life, Jamie's appointment to the Continental army under General George Washington and at least one shadow from Claire's past.  Although I wanted to savor this novel, the more I read, the more quickly I wanted to read.  Truly a work of love and as always, leaves me only wanting more.

Of all of Gabaldon's books I've read this was one of my favorites.  I had to pace myself not to read too fast. Gabaldon's my favorite writer, and I have a hard time not reading the whole book in one sitting.  This book is a bit lighter on military aspects which I personally liked, and Gabaldon spends some time going back and forth between characters the last book left me wanting to know about.  And, no spoiler here, but the ending was a cliffhanger, as usual, but one leaving the reader with very nice warm fuzzy feeling. The only bad thing is waiting for four or five years for the next (supposedly last) installment of the series.

Another page turner! Many loose ends tied up; this is not easily a stand-alone book, you really have to know who's who. Just wish this had been available (as an history supplement) when I was in high school; Ms. Gabaldon makes historical people almost as human as her characters!
Loved it! Diana's writing is so real, that the characters are like family to me. Laughed, cried, got mad, etc.
Jamie and Claire back again!  I love these books.  I don't want this one to end.  I want it to go on and on and on forever!
For those of us that have followed Jaime and Claire, and then Bree and Roger, this was a fantastic story!
Great read. True to her previous Outlander books. Several references to past characters, all linked to her continuing saga. She left an opening for another......eagerly awaiting the next.
I didn't want it to end! Diana Gabaldon has done it again. I Will read this book again and again.
I am in awe of Mrs Diana Gabaldon. In my opinion, she has no equal in terms of imagination, wit, and her linguistic gifts! Bravo, and I will be waiting patiently for the next novel/novella!
Waited a long time but worth it!  I am greedy, any more to look forward to?  What a great start to summer!

I loved this series and this book. It picks up right where the last one ended without skipping a beat. This one, however, did leave me with several unanswered questions leaving me to wonder if there is another book to follow. For example; what happened to William,  what about Ben's wife, and where is Ben? Who set the print shop on fire and what of Fergus' inheritance?  Many questions left unanswered here, more than I have listed but a great read.
As usual, I race through these books and look forward to re-reading them while waiting for the next installment.  A wonderful series and this one was as delightful as the other 7!
This book is beyond amazing!  Loved it from cover to cover!  Only complaint is that I wish it was longer!  When you get to that last page you go noooooo!!!

The continuing saga of the (now) extended family that began eight books ago when Claire meet Jamie enriches the reader with all the details the senses can manage: visual, scent, and especially feeling.  This is well written and evenly paced and very fulfilling. All in all it is a most enjoyable time consuming adventure.  It is such fun to encounter both real and literary historical characters as they interact with the wonderful imaginary ones that inhabit Ms Gabaldon's world.
I love the outlander series and this book was a wonderful addition. I can't wait to see what happens next!

As always with Diana Gabaldon, this is a "can't put it down", smashing good read.  We see Jamie & Claire reunited, find Lord John's brother, Hal, in the New World with his regiment, see Jenny's introduction to America, follow Ian's romance with Rachel, get to know William a lot better and all the while follow the lives of Brianna & Roger and lots, lots more.  What the book does, more than anything as it follows the family in the midst of the Revolution & reunites the McKenzies in Scotland after some amazing twists & turns, is weave a wealth of new plot lines & close with a real cliff-hanger on Frazier's Ridge.  Wonderfully typical Gabaldon storytelling that's not to be missed.
The continuing story of Jamie and Claire.  What could be better.  Diana Gabaldon does it again.  A complete page turner.
My favorite author and her best book yet!  Beautifully crafted plot with all the elements converging at one place and time was masterful.
Just another book in a great series!  LOvE the whole set!  Can't wait for the next one to find out what happens to the family next!
The lives of Claire and Jamie continue...Diana hit it right on again!  I can't wait for the next one!!!!  I don't think I can wait another four years.
