Four stars because I am a little tired of Clair always seeing Jamie as "tall, slim, handsome, etc." OK, he's gorgeous, we get that. Move on, Clair. Aside from that picky note, I enjoyed the book very much and am happy that it ends with everyone back on the Ridge. I especially like the Grey family inclusion; I think Lord John and the rest of the Grey family are witty, intelligent and at times, hilarious. I am waiting for the next book and hope it doesn't take too long to publish.
If she never writes another word in this series, it's a great way to go. Well worth the wait. Can't wait for the next book!
I have been reading the Outlander series from the start and a, always amazed at the detail and how much I care about the characters.
Spectacular latest installation of my favorite characters!  I read these books until they literally fall apart, had to switch to kindle!
Diana Gabaldon has taken us to visit with all of our old friends, caught us up on all of their news and left us dangling again. Hope we don't have to wait so long this time to find out what happens.

Anyone who has read her previous books will be well satisfied with the story as it takes off from the end of her last book.  All questions are answered with a great story, and of course the ever present cliff hanger at the end. It was totally enjoyed and will be treasured with all the others
Just finished and I miss them already but it ended as I had hoped that it would. It was awesome.
Book 8 is a "must read" for fans of the Outlander series. While solving most of the cliffhanger events from book 7, it weaves in enough new plot twists to make you beg for book 9.
Well worth the wait. I've read them all and loved every minute of each book, sometimes reading until 2am because I could not put it down Please write another one soon!

Felt the parts about Brianna's family in Scotland were disjointed and implausible.  However, I really enjoyed the continuing saga of Jamie and Claire and the rich history of the early Revolutionary War.  Love the lively cast of changing characters and even the realistic medical bits.

Diana does it again!  Not surprising for us fans...her writing is superb. She weaves the character plots and the war flawlessly!  Can't believe I finished it so fast now I have to wait another five years!!!!!!
Loved this latest Outlander novel! The whole series is just great! Diana does it again for us! Now to read it again !

Diana's books are never a disappointment  The only disappointment is that I will have to wait a couple of years for the next one  Now I will go listen to Davina Porter read it to me on my commute to and from work
Diana Gabaldon never lets her fans down with this wonderful saga of Jamie and Claire.  Another great read and one that will be read over and over again.

If you are just now hearing about Diana Gabaldon, welcome to her incredible world within The Outlander series, including her side novels and novellas, which are all interrelated. She is a remarkable author with a true gift for emerging the reader into history and allowing the reader to fall deeply in love with her characters.  There are not enough superlatives to describe her novels; this book is true to form.  What a delight to be invested in her world once again.  Rereading her books allows you to survive until the next book comes out.

Started great, it was wonderful to be back. The side story of Roger and Bree, was a real interruption of the story and left me disappointed.so overall I enjoyed the book but was totally bored by parts of it.
Delightful.. Well worth the wait and such a great read.  I had to ration it over several days just to prolong the fun.  Can't wait for the next one!!

A much anticipated book, I re-read the previous two books in the months before the release of this episode. I was not disappointed, the author doesn't run out of unique ideas of where to take the story. I like the odd pithy statement and save these as I notice other people do as well. The book made me smile for the four days it took me to read it - slowly, savoring ever chapter.
Couldn't put it down. I can not wait for the series to be released on TV on August 9 2014.

After waiting forever I was so glad to get my copies of MOBY - yes I read it on my first Kindle, my Kindle HD and hard copy going back and forth depending on where I was and how my battery was doing. I was glad that it quickly resolved the cliff-hangers from Echo and enjoyed the entire read. Fi! to those who only like Jamie and Claire. Without the other characters the texture of the story would be so plain. I found this series on the third book and quickly found the first two. I now read them from beginning to end each time there is a new one and have also gone back to read them all again just because they are so wonderful. Funny but at the end of this one I wondered if it could be the last. Yes there were things still unresolved but that is often the way in a good book. If I found myself crying over the death of a good dog - I can't imagine what I'll do when something happens to Jamie, Claire or any of the others. Thank you Dianna for bringing these characters to life and for all of the other books that have expanded on Lord John, Michael, Marseli's sister, and more. I look forward to the next one and hope that it won't be the end.

If only we could put a bionic arm on Ms. Gabaldon so she could WRITE FASTER. This series is wonderful; these are books that you can fall into -- time is suspended when you are in her world, spending time with her well-written, deeply drawn characters. My guess after reading MOBY is that there will be another two books at least... so looking forward to several more years of reading pleasure.

I've read all of  Diana Gabaldon's books and  found them all we'll written  and extremely entertains.. She draws you into the story and you get to know the characters so well you can't wait to read what happens next.  I'm looking forward to her next book,

First of all, I liked it; BUT, I wish it was longer, and I thought there were too many things left unanswered. Like William. Where did he go?  And Bri & Roger, what happened inbetween times?  What & WHY happened in 1980?  It's not really explained why the bad guy did what he did. Was it only the gold or was it the thing her father Frank told her about?  And, I wish it hadn't ended where it did!  Well, I guess (hope?) it will all be explained in the ninth book?!  Of course I anxiously waited for this book and will read anything I can get my hands on from Diana, and I HAVE recommended the books to friends and strangers alike, and will continue to do so. I'm getting ready to re-read it. Maybe I missed things in my hurry through it the first time!
Gabaldon continues to weave the multiple threads of her characters, time lines and history together.  Glad to catch up with folks she created so vividly and to follow their lives and stories.
It was terrific. I've read the whole series & couldn't wait for the next one. It didn't disappoint. Sadly it looks like the last one.

Each and every book in the Outlander series deserves 5 stars . I wish that I could have paced myself and read  it more slowly to make it last longer but I couldn't put it down! Now I have to be patient and wait for the next one.
I love this series and this was no exception but I felt the ending left me hanging. I'm sure that was Roger Mac and Brianna but would have liked to experience the reunion in writing.
Loved this book! Very talented writer.  Her whole "Outlander" series is the best series I have ever read?  Ms. Gabaldons books are read repeatedly.
Now I will have to wait how long for the next one? Thank you for this momentary escape from my reality.

I am a die hard fan of Outlander! I have read all the books many times to prepare myself for the next book coming out. This book 8 has so really good stuff and some sections that drag, granted I am not a fan of military strategy. Will doubtless re-read them all again for book 9.
I laughed, cried, hoped, fell in love, prayed, wished and hoped and in the end it was wonderful.  Fantastic ending to a great series!

I've yet to find a series to equal the Outlander series, and savored every moment of reading/listening to WMOHB.  Besides the first book, this is the best for action, emotion, plot lines, and character development.  One or two characters are getting tiresome--William, by name.  Otherwise, it is a joy to read.
Fast paced, riveting continuation of characters we have grown to love!  Hope the story doesn't end here. I have waited so long to read about these characters!

I was about 70 per cent through this book when I realized there would be another book in the series and I was elated.  I've loved this series more than any other I've read.  It has everything and I fell in love with the characters in the first book and this is no. eight.

So I've been reading these books since the first one accidentally showed up at my mom's house in a book-of-the-month-club thing.  They have gone far beyond the original two books and seem to have taken on a life of their own.  There seems to be another book needed after this one, in my opinion, but you'll have to read it yourself and see if you agree.  This is my first Kindle edition of one of these books, and I like being able to instantly look up some of the Gaelic words, and highlight/notate them.

This was a satisfying addition to a beloved series.  Gabaldon does a great job of character development.  Reading this installment felt like a visit to old friends.  If you haven't read the series, however, don't start with this book.  You'll be completely lost.

Diana Gabaldon has done it again and done it even better.  Her storytelling genius keeps getting better.  When I first read Outlander,  I was amazed that a writer could keep up the tempo, excitement, depth of characters and sheer adventure for the  whole book.  MOBY, as she and fans call this,  the eighth in the series is everything a reader wants in a book.  How does she do it?  But do it,  she Does!
About 50 pages into the book, I thought "She's a cruel woman."  After that, it got even better. A must read.
Loved it from beginning to end!!  Didn't get much sleep because I could not put it down.  Worth the long wait and will be reading it again!!!

Another delicate and successful balance between then and now. Characters are still compelling, nothing trite or boring about the Outlander saga!  The ending is very satisfying but leaves you looking forward to the next book.
This book, like all of hers will make you laugh, cry, grumble and cheer.  It's also good for the vocabulary builder app on your Kindle!

This did wrap up a lot of loose ends from book 7. I enjoyed getting to know the characters a bit more. I would have liked a little bit more on Roger and Bree but I do understand the need to introduce new characters. I loved the way that the Ian and Rachel storyline progressed. I am anticipating book 9 already...its going to be a long wait!

Excellent book!  Just prepare yourself for a roller coaster.  Diana Gabaldon does it again!  Put aside two or three hours at a time.  You won't want to put it down.  Unless it's just to catch your breath.
The wait was well worth the content! I will be re-reading it again and again to find what I missed the first go round. Thank you thank you thank you!!
Just what we would expect out of this wonderful author! Definitely wrapped up all those loose ends she left us hanging with, in the last book!
I'm still reading. If you ask me where I am. I'm in the 17th century worrying about what's going on in 1980. Losing mind with worry.

Beautifully written! I so enjoy the outlander series. Not one book has disappointed me. This is as beautifully written as the previous ones. Thank you, for an enjoyable reading experience. So...... I have read comments on this and other sites that Claire has to be post menopausal alluding that Claire can not possibly enjoy sex. Believe me life does not end at post menopause. As I am in the medical profession and post menopause I speak in knowledge and experience. Sex post menopause can be just as satisfying or even better than when a woman is in her twenties. That is not fiction. It is a state of mind in all aspects. So you go girl Claire!!!
How can you describe the joy of reading a book you have been waiting for for a long time? I loved this book and dont know how I will wait four or so years for the next installment.

I waited forever for this book, now I will have to wait  for the next!  Ms Gabaldon kept me enthralled in her book. Every free moment was spent reading , til I finished. She tied up several story lines to only introduce new ones.  She is masterful storyteller, and I loved this book.
Another page turner!  I couldn't put it down and am now very far behind on all my work. Guess I'll get that done now, then read this again a little slower!
Always captivating in every aspect. As I read it felt like sipping good wine.  It answered all my questions and made me form quite a few more. Sad to be done with it.

Ms. G has rewarded our rabid patience with yet another heart wrenching and engrossing look at our favourite time traveling doctor. Including Who! lol. I only wish that with all the cliffhangers, I wont have to wait as long this time for the next book. I picked up Outlander in my late teens, and now am still foaming at the mouth, dying to get my hands on the next book. I am hoping that we are graced with a few more short (relatively) stories, while awaiting the next tome.

OUTLANDER fans have been waiting for this book for a long time. Waiting impatiently to find out what happened to Jem and to continue Claire and Jamie's story. This book did not disappoint. WELL DONE Diana. Thank You.

Along with many others, I've waited a long time for "My Own Heart's Blood" to be released. I was thoroughly captivated by the continuation of the story. I enjoyed the bringing around of characters full circle. Spoiler: why Henri-Christian? I think we need an Outlander world like "Pottermore" for all of Gabaldon's many characters! Thanks Diana for bringing you world to us.
Another amazing, engaging, erudite and thoroughly enjoyable read by Diana Gabaldon. Looking forward to the TV Outlander Series appearing later this year.

I was so happy to get this, and now I'm so sad I have finished it.  I did find a section of it moving slowly, but it picks up again.  If I were to make a critical statement it would be that this novel moves a bit slower, but I love the fact that important characters are now in the same location, interacting with each other.
To fall into Claire and Jamie's world again is a rare pleasure.  It's been a long wait, but well worth it!

It meets everything I was hoping for!  Jamie and Claire are aging right, they are still so in love. Jenny is wonderful and the family is just awesome! Not being wealthy doesn't mean anything, family is.

Well  we now know what happened to Jem. This is one wild ride. The amount of talent involved in writing these stories just amazes me! I cried at the end. Still left with wanting more of this beloved tale I will wait patiently for more. Thank you Diana for taking us on this journey with you!

When I finished Echo I was so upset since every main character was left in some sort of terrible peril.  In this book, the author has at last brought us some closure.  All of the main characters have reached some level of peace in their lives.  For me, although I don't want the series to end, I could stop here.  Thanks, Diana Gabaldon!
I wish that the breathless wonder of this story of Claire and Jamie would never end. I am sad to have read the book so fast, and kept trying to slow down. Oh well, I can just read it again!

The book was amazing as usual. I can't wait for the next installment. I read the book as soon as i got it but am currently reading the series again and on the 4th book. I am looking forward to reading it again when I have finished the rest.

I couldn't wait to get my hands on this book, and I was not disappointed! I didn't want to put it down, except that pesky thing known as a JOB forced me to do so occasionally. I can't wait to read the next book!
Once agian totally engrossing and a page turner! Diane has outdone herself once again. A wonderful masterpiece to go along with all the others in this series

Another superb book from Diana Gabaldon. History, romance, adventure all wrapped up in one great novel.  She never ceases to amaze me with her plot twists and turns. The kind of book I will read over and over as it is too good just to read once.

I haven't finished this book yet but was so thrilled to get back into the story of Jamie and Claire and their family. I was a late comer to the Outlander series and have never devoured a series like I have this one!

These are the best books I have ever read and I read a lot. This author is by far my favorite author. I have met recommended these to any one who did not love these books.  My brother started me on them so they are loved by men and women alike.
I love all of her books. They pull you in right away and hold you forever. This whole series will be read by me over and over!

So glad to reconnect with these characters. I found myself looking up separate parts and real people who participated in The American Revolution!!!!  Love Love Love this Outlander world.  This series has gone on so long and SO WELL DONE, the characters SO well known and loved.... They feel almost real.
As usual, the book is funny, moving, adventurous, educational... Everything that makes Diana Gabaldon a great writer. The only thing wrong with it is how long we'll have to wait for the next book! 😕
This was well worth the long wait, if you are reading this, or thinking about reading, then you have read the series and you know it won't disappoint, Diana never does!
Five years until the next one..sigh........ At least there's the Starz show to look forward to.....hope they did a good job.
I love this series and I was not disappointed. I could not put it down. I can't wait for the next one Diana writes.
I loved it. Was going to read in small segments, finished in two days.  I would not change anything about it.
Waited 4 years for this to come out and resolve the cliffhanger ending to An Echo in The Bones; and, it was the desired ending. This is absolutely the best series of books I've ever read!

Loved this latest installment in the series. It resolves a lot of the issues which were hanging from the previous full novel.  This is my absolute favorite book series.  I am not sure how Diana Gabaldon does it, she is able to write with sophistication but also talk about things we all can relate to. She will make you laugh, cry, gasp, and sigh. This is not just a story, these characters feel like family.

The latest book in the Outlander series continues to excite, intrigue, frustrate, devastate and  entrance readers. Diana Gabaldon brings the American Revolution to life through the characters we love, and then we're swept forward to the future in others. Many twists and turns in the adventure keeps the reader hanging on! Love it!

These books always take me a bit to get into, and this one was no exception. Once it gets you though, it doesn't let go. The story was very absorbing and difficult to put down. There were multiple occasions where I was on the edge of my seat and quickly reading to find out what happens next. I was very happy to see so much inclusion of Lord John and his family. I highly recommend rereading an Echo in the Bone before this one. I was glad I did, as I had forgotten many of the details, and these two books dove tail with one another.

As with all,of her previous books,this one drags you back into the world of Claire and Jamie (and Bree, Roger, etc) and keeps you enthrall end until the very last page when you say "oh no it's over?? What about...." (Or maybe are just me...). Loved it!

I received Outlander free for my new Kindle a few years ago and have been hooked on the series ever since. I love historical fiction and Diana Gabaldon is one of the best. Each novel gets better and better. All I can say is WOW! I will be counting the time until the next one.

Wonderful book. I didn't want it to end. I will wait for the next book and read everything I can about this one. Diana writes great stories. This book answered questions left by the last book but still made me want for the story yo how on.
So. Good. I remember feeling like Echo took a long time and there were slightly boring parts before you got sucker punched at the end, but this was perfection. I finished it in almost exactly 1 week.

What a run!!!  I sprinted to the finish and found myself nearly falling off the edge of the world when I  read the last thank you from author, Diana Gabaldon. I'm thrilled and disappointed at the same time. I didn't want it to end!  My husband texted me today to say that he'd finished the book. Earlier as I was coming into the home stretch, I exclaimed to him, "I can't believe these aren't REAL PEOPLE. Thank you, Diana for all the pleasure you've brought into the lives of so many. Your writing is just thoroughly entertaining and satisfying. Please tell me you already have at least half of the next book written!!!

Once Diana Gabaldon has scored another winner in the fantastic Outlander series.  I will be sitting the edge of my chair waiting for the next installment of the adventures of Claire, Jamie and the rest of their extended family and friends. Four years can't pass fast enough for me. To tide me over, I'll continue rereading where I left off in dragonflies in amber.  Diana Gabaldon, you rock.

I purchased this book because I've read all of  the the books in this series and love Diana's books. Most I've read more than once. The series has the perfect mix of romance, history and science fiction. There are places around the world  that were built by ancient cultures that  historians speculate about.
As usual, terrific!  I loved it.  Ms Gabaldon is a marvel. If only it was a 10,000 page book. Muchas gracias.
I'd recommend this book to everyone. I love the entire series. The characters are SO real.  Now we have to wait for book 9 to be written.
loved the book!thank you for that! I miss Jamie and Clarie,and I have to go back and re-read all the stories from day one to get my fix.

I read this book as quickly as possible without succumbing to sleep deprivation. As always, Gabaldon inserts bright new threads and pulls up some old ones while weaving her tapestry of historical and domestic drama and comedy. Her spot-on, timeless.  observations of family life and vividly imagined 17th-century settings make this series unique. I have just one astonished criticism. The author  and her publishers strive for accuracy and achieve it. I found one typo, which is miraculous these days. But the family or clan tartan was a 19th-century invention, attributable in large part to the imagination of Sir Walter Scott, the enterprise of weavers who knew  good idea when they saw it, and a queen who fell in love with Scotland. I am mystified as to why Gabaldon would perpetuate the myth, which was debunked long ago. ("Scotland and Her Tartans: The Romantic Heritage of the Scottish Clans and Families, by Alexander Fulton, 1991, is a great read.) To end on the up beat, "A Leaf on the Wind of All Hallows" is required reading after you finish "Written..." It reveals the fate of a key character.

For other Outlander fans, you'll want to read this one. The Lord John books - meh - not that interesting for me. This book follows the paths of many of the characters you've learned to love in prior books in this series. I was often brought to tears, and now I need to re-read them all. It was like meeting a dear friend after a long absence. Bravo, Diana! You're still my favorite author.
Well, I really liked the end.  I'm sad I'm done....I may just have to start over.  Jaimie and Clair continue to expose us to a lot of geography, history, and hormones.
As usual Diana has kept me spell bound in the world of Jamie and Claire! It saddens me that time flies the way it does, but hurry up 2018 (?) for book #9!!!! Bravo Diana, bravo!
have read the entire series.  absolutely held me thru the length of the book's.  the characters are diverse and interesting.  Well worth the time reading.

I love this series and I am devastated that I must wait another four or five years for another fix! I think about the characters and the world  that Gabaldon has created long after I have read the last page. The tremendous craftsmanship of the writing usually RUINS me for other authors for months! By far my favorite series and  author. I would have liked to have seen a bit more of Bree and Roger, but I am glad that the story still centers around Jamie and Claire! Perhaps a few less nonessential characters would keep the plot less cumbersome. More please!!
Loved this book. So much better than the last.  Diana has recaptured the raw emotion and passion of the earlier books in the series.  I can't wait for the next one.
It's not easy chasing a toddler, running a household, and reading this book! It's too hard to put down! So I try to read when the house sleeps.
Loved it.  This was a book worth waiting for. I was especially excited to see my hometown figure into the story. All these years of following the characters, I felt like they came to me.

As always, this book holds you in its grip as a master storyteller weaves the intricacies of her web.  It's funny and sad, historically accurate and enlightening and compelling as it's predecessors.  My only complaint is that it never lasts long enough and we'll have to wait another 2 to 3 years for the next one.  Bravo, Diana! You've done it again.
I was wondering if I could give this book 6 stars!  I devoured the story and am hoping there will be another in the series.

I started re-reading all of the books (beginning with Outlander) as soon as I finished this.  I am going to incorporate the LJG books as part of this re-read, along with the bulges.  It's not enough to last me four years until the next big book comes out, but it'll keep me from going insane!
I absolutely loved this book.  I had just finished a book that repeated everything 2-3 times and was just poorly written. It was like a breath of pure mountain air to read WIMOHB.
This book was worth waiting 5 years! Great mix of history, fiction, and romance. Can't wait for the next one.

Having devoured each of the previous books, I am perhaps not an unbiased reader...The characters slide from one adventure to another and the need to see how they got out of the current fix was responsible for several late nights and many undone tasks until the conclusion.  It was great to see many of the more memorable ssecondary characters from past books temporarily take center stage (Hermin and Vermin, for instance).
Loved reading book . It ended to soon . I  hope there is another book to follow. Thankyou Diana Gabaldon.
So happy to read more of my favorite people. This book is awesome! Excellent forward movement on all characters. I can't believe I've finished it. I want more.

Wonderful.....that's all I can say without giving anything away. And while there are not as many loose ends at the end of this book, I still am eagerly awaiting the next one. Just not sure if I can wait several years!!!

After chomping at the bit waiting for the release date, I was almost afraid to begin this book. Diana Gabaldon takes you on an emotional ride with all of the books in the Outlander series and I had to overcome my fear and dive in. (It is like when you find out you're expecting your second child and instead of delighting in the joy, you cry when you're alone knowing you'll have to go into labor again. it's a joyful sense of dread) Just finished and I have to say, I loved it!  If you love a well written, great adventure with lots of history, intrigue, and romance with characters that are fully fleshed (who come to feel like family) - start at the beginning with Outlander and READ THESE BOOKS!

In interviews Diana has said that her work is hard to classify. I think that is exactly why her works are so popular; they are not pigeon-holed into one genre. This new book is classic "Diana," in that there is a bit of something for everyone: science fiction, romance, war, mystery, history, suspense, medicine. There is never a dull moment in a Diana Gabaldon's novel. The only remaining question is, when is the next one coming out?!?

as always, I just want more.  As a reenactor who has survived many a hot and humid day at Battle of Monmouth reenactments, I loved that this battle was highlighted and that Ms. Gabaldon set the atmosphere - the unrelenting heat and humidity of this event makes it an (almost) annual badge of honor - so perfectly.  The desire to shed your petticoats and gowns, shoes and stockings, to rid yourself of the constricting stays and pull your shift as far away from you as modesty permits - captured.  So, that delighted me.  More delightful was the story and the interwoven story lines, the introduction of new characters, the expanded role of older ones and the embrace of other characters from past books as the Frasers and their loved ones struggle with the obstacles placed before them.  Thank you, Diana Gabaldon, for making the wait worthwhile and this new telling of Jamie and Claire's lives together so deeply satisfying.

Waiting years between installments of this series is sometimes pure torture, but each one is well worth the wait. Ms. Gabaldon has a rare talent for making her characters come alive. Settings and plot twists engage the reader's imagination in a way few other authors have mastered. It is always a pleasure to return to the world of Claire, Jamie, Brianna, and Roger.  I am only saddened that the wait for the next book as begun.

This is the prize we have been waiting for.  Our reward for patience... the plum in the pudding. MOBY is all of those and more. We finally have the answers to all those questions and unresolved isses we have waited so impatiently for.  Diana Gabaldon leaves us satisfied, but still with enough new characters and the promise of more to come in her next book that we will once again hang in there for the next one... It is worth your while to read the rest of the series before reading MOBY... It is the icing on a very delicious cake.
Another amazing novel. I've laughed, cried, cursed, and praised Diana GAbaldon throughout this novel. I'm going to reread it right away!
Loved the book... Hate that it's over.... Oh well time for a reread when will August ninth be here, huh?

Outlander and the following books are my all time favorite, and that is saying a lot, since I am an avid reader. I spent way too much time reading this latest installment in two days.  It was a great read.  I am not sure if the author intends to continue the series, or if this is the final one, though.  She did leave it in such a way that it could go either way in my opinion.  If I do have to wait 5 more years for another book, it will be an easier wait than it was for this one. Most of the questions are answered for me in this one.  Diana does a great job of researching and following history, but my favorite parts are always Claire and her doctoring.  Well done!
With a book this lengthy...you would think it would drag or slow. Not once. In fact, when it was over, there was a sense of NOOoooo!! That good. Really! Seriously! I mean it! Absolutely a 5 Star Wow!

I have been a loyal follower of this series since the beginning 20+ years ago and love them all, but this book took too long and it ended poorly.  Only Davina Porter can really be the narrator of these books, she is the best.  But I want to know how Bree/Roger did it.  What happened to Buck?  Will there be another book?  Will Ian and Rachel carry on the best love stories ever?  I'm so looking forward to the STARZ series and can only hope that they give 1/2 of the passion the Diana writes with.  I love this book series, but give me answers. PLEASE!!!

I feel this is one of her best in the series. Outlander is and always will be my favorite, but this book is running a close second. Amazing job she does with characters and facts ( historical, scientific, etc!) way long wait in between them but well worth it.
Diana Gabaldon has written another completely perfect book. Thank you for your talent, and I cannot wait for book 9, further adventures with Jamie and Claire

Was not disappointed. The ending did not leave you extremely upset like Echo In The Bone but still left you wanting more of the story.  There are still many questions left to be answered which means more books!

What can't Diana Gabaldon do with words. I read a book a day and can say wholeheartedly "this is the best series of books on the market". Hands down. Her adherence to history lines is held tight and is a marvel how well she makes the family and life of Jamie and Claire live on the pages!  The ending was perfect!  I cried for happy!  Now to read it again and again and again.
Loved this 8th book in the series!  I laughed, cried and gasped out loud during the 6 days it took me to read.
My stomach was clenched in fear as I read the book - I was that worried about the characters. I loved this book. <3

I can't even put in to words how Diana's writing touches my very being.  It's nothing I have ever experienced before.  You have to read the series for yourself to understand......you won't regret it!  WARNING......You may need a "support group" before it is done lol!
Another wonderful novel by Diana Gabaldon. She covered a lot of ground in this one and amazingly there is still a long way to go. Guess another three to four years to the next book.

It is always so hard to put down a new Outlander novel. Once I start I can't seem to stop!!! I loved it. So much waiting and apprehension about what would come next, and Diana never fails to deliver!!!!!

It felt so good to hear from the frsers and Mackenzie's again. Diana gabaldons done it again encompassing all that we'd like to hear about. Upon reading feeling upset about a certain persons passing that we all loved and an sooo awaited adventure for someone who's never left their home.  Ugh now waiting for a new book again. I just can't take the waiting anymore.  Thanks Diana

Book 8. It's no wonder that these characters feel like family. Eight huge tomes that tell the story of a marriage, an auld country's heartbreak and a new country's struggle. Books that have been devoured to find out what happens next to these people we care about and then re-read and savored until the next one comes out.  This book was worth the wait.

Diana Gabaldon's novel, My Own Heart's Blood, was well worth the wait.  The Outlander series is by far my favorite.  While reading My Own Heart's Blood my family would remind me to "pace myself."  I knew i would be sad If I finished the book too fast. What does that mean? I want to read and inhale the words as the stories and the characters become real to me. Yes, I have finished the novel. A wonderful moment at the end of the book ...when you want more!

Having read all of the previous Outlander books by Diana Gabaldon multiple times, this eighth novel in the series was worth the wait. I'm thoroughly enjoying this foray into American history via Claire, Jamie, and all the other characters who comprise the world of Outlander.

Although we all enjoy a bit of suspense, it is gratifying to read a book that does not belabor that point. Situations happen, as they always do with great regularity in the Fraser Family, et al. But they are resolved in a timely fashion and without too much damaging trauma, this time around. This is a truly enjoyable book. I was sad that it had to end.
Could not put it down but had to when I realized I had been reading for 14 hours.  I thought she  brought everyone who had been mentioned in previous books into this one.  I really loved it.

I have waited just like everyone else, just like every Big Book for years for this release.  I was not disappointed it had adventure, and anticipation in every moment.  It is just amazing how she brings together this cast of characters with such emotion and heart felt familiarity. A page turner, I could not lay down. Read all 800 + pages in a day an an half. That is the only negative, I wanted to savor this on, as the next will be another 4 years, and I will be here just waiting with as much enthusiasm as I was tof Written in My Own Heart's Blood.  I would recommend this book to anyone, and feel that there is no way they would be disappointed.
This is an awesome book, but who expected anything else?  Diana let us see more of the Greys and William.  Of course Claire and Jamie!  Great story telling and as always, I can't wait for the next!

You experience it viscerally.  Across time and space from the Highlands of Scotland to the Revolutionary War in Philadelphia, she picks up the threads of EIGHT different cliffhangers and seamlessly weaves the reader back into the lives of her much beloved characters.  It is too soon after release for spoilers, so I shall stop here.
Another wonderful extension that will make your heart race and tears fall. Yet again, leaving you wanting more, more, more. Here's to waiting another four years. It's always worth it.

It's very difficult to write (and read) eight novels and maintain the readers interest throughout. Not only has Diana done so wonderfully, but she also gave the reader the satisfaction of learning the end result of each trial in the story before the end of that book. She created a love for characters, which keeps you wanting to read the next book.

I had a hard time getting into this book.  However, knowing the author to be of the highest quality, I read on.  As the book passed over my eyes, I found myself slowing down my reading to make this wonderful experience last.  Finishing the book, I am awaiting the next one.  My attention will never be lost for this story.  Well done Diana Gabaldon.

This 8-book series is amazing!  This, WRITTEN IN MY OWN HEART'S BLOOD, was a little more difficult to follow since all the characters were in different locations and times.  Still, the historic information and the story-line were so engaging.  I have felt like I knew these prople.  Can't wait to see the TV series.....upgrading my cable to do that.

I had very high expectations and the all the plot lines seemed to fit comfortably. I was especially heart warmed by the tenderness that Jamie and Claire share as they have gotten older. Yes, there are a lot of characters to keep track of- but they seemed much more purposeful this time around as the saga includes a wider scoop of the Fraser's life.

As always, this woman, Diane Gabaldon, stepped up to the plate and knocked it out of the park. The stories are heart-wrenching, funny, and thrilling, These beloved characters are like family after eight marvelous books, and I hate to part with them at the end of every single book. I can't wait for the next adventure. There will be another, right?

In anticpation of the release of this book I re-read all the books from the beginning.  Fantastic continuation of a terrific story.  Diana creates characters that are very believable and her description of the setting is so full you can capture what it must have looked like.  Can't wait for book 9.  As usual Diana does not disappoint her readers!

I found this a fascinating novel, A bit complex at times with the idea of time travel, but when I got that sorted out I was impressed with the way we saw the depth of feeling in the characters especially in times of war and conflict. There was a lot of informtion to be gleaned as well, Medical, Religious and just human life. A very interesting novel

My daughter picked up one of books for me (The Scottish Prisoner) while I was recovering from surgery. WOW!!! I'm so hooked and a huge fan now. I just can't get enough of her books. I'm working on the John Greg series as well, since I've caught up on Outlander. Can't wait to get my hands on MOH-B. Hard to find since her books fly off the shelves.

I'm more in love with the Outlander series than ever now. I read on Diana's blog that this is not the end of Jamie and Claire's story and I am so glad! I actually tried to read it slowly toward the end, savoring every page. I cried at the end and although an avid reader I've never done that before. Another gift of love from Diana -- thank you!!!

I love the way she writes.  I feel like I'm there in the story and she explains everything that happens in real life without avoiding some of the usual.  When she moves back and forth in time, you're able to follow her and there are not so many characters that I can keep up with everyone.  I will always buy her books,in fact I usually preorder.

The author gives us insight into the difficulties facing a physician caring for the injured in the 18th century especially during the Revolutionary War.  She maneuvers the characters so that the reader sees things from both sides of the war effort.  Dr. Clare Fraser proves vulnerable as she suffers a bullet wound during the battle at Monmouth.

I have read quite a few different series, but none has blown me away like this one. The desscriptiveness of the writing is so vivid that when you lift your head to look around you can actually see what is happening and you are the traveler, transported to another place and time. THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH.  I am looking forward to the next series.

At long last ... This latest book in the Outlander series was terrific!  It picked up the story line as if I'd just put down book 7 shortly before, instead of a few years ago.  I took my time reading it, because it will be a while before the next book, and I savored every line.  Hated for it to come to an end ... now the next long wait begins.

Just love the story and am waiting for Ms Gabaldon to write the next book in the series.  Will re-read Written In My own  Heart's Blood again as well as the rest of the series by starting over with the Outlander.  I know I didn't want to put either book in the series down until I finished it, then was in a hurry to always start the next book.

I loved each and every one of Diana Gabaldon's Outlander books. I love the feeling of living in Claire and Jamie's world. I read all 8 books in just a few months; each book over 900 pages. Now I understand why so many end up reading the series over and over. What a treat to be enveloped in the world of Outlander. Read them and be transformed!

A long read and some parts I really enjoyed however for me the stories did not mesh or link together in an understandable way. At times I almost gave up reading it but was always hopeful things would get better. Some amazing detail and research has gone into this story and blow the bagpipes for that but too long winded to rate it any better.

Very well written and historically detailed, as usual from Gabaldon. I was disappointed in two problems with the plot which should have been caught in the editing process, but overall the book nicely advanced the storyline of Jamie and Claire during the American Revolution. It will be hard to wait another four years for the next installment.

I re-read all of the Outlander books before ordering Written in My Own Hearts Blood--and then could hardly wait for it to arrive. The wait was well worthwhile. The book is great--filled with everyday life in the context of the time and with people I would like to know. The only problem is now I have to WAIT for the next book to be written!

I think this book is the weakest in the series.  I don't mind the sex scenes but there was much more of that in this book and less story.  There was too much repetition and overall it wasn't as interesting as the other novels.  That is not to say I didn't enjoy it; it is still a fun read but I know Diana Gabaldon is capable of much better.

Love to the love this series!  Diana did not disappoint me at all.  Other reviews that  I had read were not happy with the ending.  I think that they were wrong!  Loved that the book took right off and brought me back into Jamie and Claire's lives.  Loved that the ending kept me thinking and wishing that the next book was already written!

Finally the conclusion of the Outlander series of Jami and Clare, good to have bring it full circle. It circled back to most all the characters from the previous novels however since it was some time since reading the other novels I had some issues remembering some of the incidents that happened in book 1,2,3 ect. But still worth reading.

Another winner. I binged on all 8 books and I want to know when the next one will be published.  While others may feel the author goes into too much detail, I welcome all of it. I Have gotten to know these characters and am made to consider what I would be like in similar circumstances.  I have not skipped pages.  I have read every word.

It took a while to get back into the characters in this latest Outlander book. I think the author waited almost too long to publish the next offering. Slowly but surely, as I kept reading, I was drawn once again into the world of Claire and Jamie. I still don't think it's the best one of the series, but it's a satisfying read in the end.

Diana Gabaldon has not disappointed me yet!  She is able to make the characters come to life and the story line believable.  I have enjoyed all of her Outlander series books; from the first to this latest addition.  She is able to combine fantasy, humor, love and mystery all into one.  I have recommended this series to all of my friends!

I have loved all that I have read by Diana Gabaldon. If this is the end, it feels okay.  Love the characters. I get lost sometimes with words not in my vocabulary or in different languages. Sometimes I get a good sense of it in context. Really love seeing how she deals with medical issues during that period.  Thanks for a wonderful read!  A plus is having an iPad with kindle on it. I can look up all the words and phrases.

Continuing in the excellent authorship she has presented in the previous novels in this series. Both my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed this episode into the lives of the characters previously developed. Dana Gabaldon is a unique author, blending the fantasy of time travel, romance and history into a compelling series of adventure novels.

MOBY is written in Diana's usual style.  Not her best book in the series but a needed one to connect all the dots to the characters. Give us more of this wonderful historical romance. Which really doesn't describe the series at all, there is so much more. I was sad to see it end as we have to wait so long for the 9th book in the series.

I'm about 80% through the book and love it!  True to form, Diana Gabaldon is a master!  And to top it off, Starz has begun their own series on Outlander!  I'm a fan for sure!  Read these in order folks and don't let the amount of pages deter you.  You will be transported into the book and you will hope the story never ends...............

I have loved all the other Outlander books, but this one didn't seem to have the same focus on the Jamie/Claire relationship.  I thought that the Roger/Brianna story line was also a little weak.  I thought that there would be more of the Jamie/William story. Overall I still will purchase any book she writes.  She is an excellent author.

It's always a little depressing when finishing a new Outlander book.....you know it's going to be a while before the next one comes out and you're left hanging and wanting to know what happened to your "friends".....Before "Written in My Own Heart's Blood" arrived, I re-read the entire series.  Loved it....you will too!

Was very disappointed in the ending of this series.  The reintroduction of Claire's rapist a few pages from the end was outlandish. Then to leave the reader hanging as to William, Lord John, Percy, Mr. Richardson and the Fergus inheritance was so blatantly inept. Sorry I wasted all those hours to be flabbergasted at the sudden ending.

Diana continues to excel! Always a wonderful adventure full of interesting details and intertwined characters! How we all love Claire and Jaime and their family and friends.  I bought this series when it first came out and started many of my friends on the same amazing journey. Please don't let that be the last book Diana!  Thank you!

Another outstanding, unforgettable book by Diana Gabladon. If you've read the other books in the series, you don't need to be told how wonderful they are.  Don't jump ahead though, read them one by one and enjoy the journey down the rabbit hole.  You'll never be the same.  And you might just get a hankering to travel to scotland.  :)

I have been reading this series from the beginning and can't imagine how I will survive the end.  This book, as with the others, maintains a strength of character that at times seems as though they can't possibly go on.  Jamie and Claire are true to their cause and to each other.  Start from the beginning and enjoy the entire series.

It's wonderful, as are all of the series, but you do need to have read the one before at least int all of them, as this book does bring in most of the characters from a lll of them at one point or other, so it can be a little confusing.  We Outlander fans all reread, the Outlander, and a couple of the others prior to Book 8's arrival

Another wonderful, wonderful novel. How Diana is capable of eliciting a complete range of emotions from the reader...Funny Jemmy & Germain. a tear on your cheek, Rollo, Henri-Christian, Claire being shot.Euphoria, Ian's wedding, the four coming up the road. A page turner but when one turns the last page you 'wish' there was more.....

The secondary characters are becoming more prominent and their story lines captivating.  Lord John's family, William, Ian, and Brianna's adventures ensure interesting sequels.  It is a bit far fetched that  everybody ends up at the same place all the time, but what the heck, it's a book.  I'm already looking forward to the next book.
The outlander series are fantastic reads....

I am an Outander fan who is continually astonished by Mrs. Gabaldons ability to keep me enthralled.  I love her writing style. I adore her character development and intimacy....I just couldn't begin to put into words how her writing effects me as an enthusiastic reader...as always I want to start the next book!! Loved this book too!

The author created another masterful masterpiece. Her words paint the reader a vivid picture of the life and times of Jaime and Claire. Please please let there be more in the near future. The end of every novel leaves me missing all the characters; like seeing a family members moving to anther country and longing for their return...

i really love the series, but this was a disappointment.  nothing really happened, I felt like I was reading a very long Christmas letter. it starts out exciting , with the Roger and Brianna story and then fell flat. just this, that and the next thing but not really a story to follow. just following what they were doing day by day.

I love time travel themes, and she does this with true talent. I especially respect her research in the history of the time and her knowledge of  and treatment of the illnesses of the time, especially with natural things. It is my hope that she will continue her story of Jamie and Claire and I live long enough to read the new book!

Diana Gabaldon is one of the best writers of all time.  I love her work.  I have purchased many sets of her books to give as gifts to my friends and we are hooked!  I can't wait to read the next one - hurry Diana - I am almost 70 years old.  I want to know what happens to Jamie and Claire before I kick the bucket!  Love your work.

My absolute favorite series of books! Once I start, I can never put them down! This was an incredible read, as were all the others. Everything is described in such great detail and with such passion that it's easy to slip into each and every characters' shoes. I've never read a better series. The details and stories are exquisite.

The last of the 8 books of the Outlander series by Diana Gabaldon.  Just like the seven books that preceded this one, the story captures attention immediately and does it from the first sentence to the last.  The characters that are met in book one, continue to intrigue and mesmerize one.  Can't wait for the next one to come out.

Having read Gabaldon's first three or four books when they were new, then lost track of those that followed, I was eager to read this latest one. It would have been better not to have taken a 20-year break from all her characters, though, because "Written . . . " isn't a stand-alone book. And it really is a bit too long.

If you've read the first 7 of her books in this series, you will love it!  If you haven't read them (besides my feeling sorry for you!) , you will love it! Sex, romance, battles and history!  True to life dialoge, believable (and lovable) characters! What more could you ask for in an 800 page book you won't want to end? Try it!

After thinking she's written all that Jamie and Claire could possibly experience and feel, Heart's Blood is as fresh and exciting as the first book.  It is a beautiful flowering of a forty year romance beset by wars, tragedies, pirates, circumstances of personal lives, and oh yes, time travel. Certainly a very satisfying read!!

These novels have it all... historical fiction, romance, time travel, science fiction... I can't turn the pages fast enough and at the same time I hate to turn those pages because I never want the book to end! This entire series is my very favorite of any  I have read. The problem is that the novels are toooo many years apart!

A long wait, but a fitting end (?) to the series (I hope not).  It was fascinating when the main characters rubbed elbows with such important historical figures.  And the detail of the period was superb, as ever.  I loved it, just as I loved the other seven books.  It was like coming home again!  I hope there is more to come.

Diana has done it again.  Wonderful continuation of a great story. MOBY (the shortened version), has love, war, friendship, tears, pretty much all live offers: I felt it all as I read.  Each character's story is expanded, new characters enter the story.  MOBY leaves you wanting more: the story of Jamie and Claire is not over.

Other than "An Echo In The Bone", I haved LOVED all of her Outlander series.  The first is the best but all of them are wonderful.  I just finished reading the whole series for the 2nd time but have read Outlander probably 6 times.  It is my all time favorite book.  The love story between Jamie and Claire is magical.

Diana Gabaldon has done it again. This novel was beautifully written with just the right balance between the characters, passion and detailed history. The long wait was definitely worth it. But if there is going to be another novel in the series I hope it will publish sooner than later, I want to live long enough to read it!

Diana G never fails to satisfy. I especially enjoyed reading this one while frequently accessing Wikipedia to check on historical characters. Learned a lot about the American Revolutionary War. I don't care about any so-called 'inaccuracies' - I just LOVE it when history is presented in such interesting and readable fashion!

As always there is hordes of eye candy in a multitude of descriptions of males, females and the earth's many lovely finer details. Plus grim realities of humans at war and our capabilities. All of this and more leave little room in a persons life other than to read and read like a wee fiend! Hate to wait another four years.

Picking up where her last book left off, Gabaldon leads us on the further adventures of the extended Fraser clan, once again from the shifting viewpoints of several primary characters. She answers many questions left hanging before, and of course leaves us wondering about more, and eagerly awaiting yet another installment.

i love the Outlander series. even went to a book signing in DC. good book. not as good as sone of the others. too many storylines it seems. of course i cant wait til the next book. even though this book is full of chapters and pages it seems like it didnt get to far along in the lives of the character...theres much to come

I am so disappointed in this book and the author.  Diana Gabaldon's Outlander series was such beautiful writing until this book.  She used words (fu....) that were not even known in that century and she did not stay true to the characters. A real let down.

Nicely researched and beautifully written, but the author overdoses on sex scenes, especially as the protagonists, Claire and Jamie, are getting a bit long in the tooth for such incredible passion in a time when neither Viagra or Estrace was available. At least it ties  up most of the loose ends in the series--or does it?

Loved it! Diana Gabaldon totally immerses you into the American Revolution. She so carefully and intricately wove the differing viewpoints of the war through her characters that you find yourself sympathizing with them all. Lots of surprises, too! I'll never get tired of Jamie and Claire. I cannot wait for the ninth book!

Gabaldon is an amazing story teller, and My Own Heart's Blood continues the story.  I never read faster than reading her Outlander series fairly racing to the next page to see what happens next.  Her attention to detail is remarkable enabling the reader to build a fully satisfying picture of whatever is going on.  Superb!

I have read all the Outlander books. I loved them from the beginning. Diane Gabaldon has become arguably my favorite author. This latest book is by far my favorite. My only complaint is that is was catagorized as a romance novel. That is not what this story is. I have recommended to all my reading friends. Give it a try.

Love this book! Probably one of my favorites in the series and definitely more than the last couple in the Outlander series. Sooo much happened, I almost have to go back and re-read it to catch all the little things I missed the first go around. Oh well, at least it will help me pass the time before book nine comes out!
